results.description:
Dear Women And Money Members,


There are only two things certain in life: death & taxes - in the opposite order - or not!  Both require financial & estate planning.


Our March monthly gathering shall focus on 'How to Construct a Tax Return'.


Supreme Court Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes stated the sentiment that every American has the duty to pay only so much tax as they are legally required.


Since we all lose, on average a third of our income to taxes, and no investment can consistently pay 33%, it's all the more important to share no more than necessary with your Uncle Sam and his cronies.


In the spirit of the season, come learn how to construct a 3-D tax return. Women are excellent money managers as they naturally integrate concepts, whereas men categorize them.


The best way to make money, is to save money.  Learn the basic concepts and use the tax laws to your advantage, especially in achieving your life goals -YOUR American Dream.


WomenAndMoney will convene, for free, on/at:

• Tuesday, 3/29, 2016, 6pm

• Offices of our hosts: ICON Securities

• 3 Park Ave. (33rd - 34th St.) - 36th Fl.

Please bring:

• A friends

• A smile

• Your questions

• Business Cards


Attendance is limited!  Pre-registration is required.

RSVP now!  (Deadline: Monday 3/28, Noon)
results.name: How to Construct a Tax Return – A Savvy Primer

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group!


Please have a government issued form of ID with you.


This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or to just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.

This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone poses a question, so bring questions!

Some topics up for discussion are:

• Install and configuration assistance

• Documentation, standards, and best practices

• Current events/Conventions

• Release testing and bug reporting

• Getting started with languages like Python and LaTeX

• -Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)

We will also have brief (approx. 5-10 minute) lightning talks, so please speak with a coordinator if you're interested in sharing some of your work.

A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

Bring a project, topic, and questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects. Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves.

results.description:
We've got two speakers this month, one from iHeartRadio and the other from Barclay's:  Kailuo Wang and Ramon Romero y Vigil! Kai will be speaking about Shapeless, Cats, and Kittens (the functional libs, not blobs of hair and claws) and Ramon will be speaking about Akka Streams. 

While you're here, checkout the iHeartRadio Technology meetup: http://www.meetup.com/iheartradio/events/198409792/

As always, the meetup officially starts at 6:30 with pizza and beer provided by Bold Radius (thanks!), and the talks will start around 7:00. Here are more details on the speakers and their talks:


Topic:

Akka Streams in Production: Dispatches From the Trenches

The Akka Streams & HTTP modules provide robust APIs for creating reactive microservices while requiring a small code footprint.  However, they can be tricky to wrestle with at times.  Many, seemingly easy, programming tasks don't have a prima facie solution that is concise.  This presentation will work through a collated set of common problems that developers come across when using Streams & HTTP in the real world.


Bio:


Ramon Romero y Vigil has spent his entire career working in the distributed computing field solving large numeric problems.  He started off in high performance computing at Los Alamos National Labs then migrated to the financial sector, initially working on real time signal analysis systems in the hedge fund space.  For the past 13 years he has been a quantitative portfolio trader utilizing clustered computing at two investment banks.  Ramon earned a bachelor’s degree in Computational Mathematics from MIT in 2001.

Topic:


Shapeless, cats, kittens and the power of generic functional programming

This short talk will give: a quick introduction to shapeless (generic programing) and cats (functional programming). Some example of kittens in practice to demonstrate the combination of the two, a brief introduction to Henkan – a project that provides type safe generic transformation built on top of these three projects. 

Bio:

Kailuo Wang is a software engineer with 12 years of experience in full-stack development. He is passionate about building elegant software solutions, film photography and free learning through open courses. He is also a devoted OSS developer. Projects that he recently contributed to include a) Akka, b) Kittens – generic programming with the power cats and shapeless, c) Kanaloa – a set of reactive work dispatchers, d) play–swagger – automatic swagger spec generation without code pollution and some minor contribution to shapeless and cats.

results.description:
Lukas Sliwka, Chief Technical Officer, Grindr

Free beer, junk food, swag and much more!

A Database Month event http://www.DBMonth.com/database/geospatial-scaling

At any minute of the day there are over a million people simultaneously using Grindr, sending 1,200+ chat messages each minute, throughout 196 countries. Behind this massive consumer facing app are monumental scaling challenges; network latency and unpredictable demand can potentially disrupt the high level of service that end-users expect. Multiple scalability, availability and performance challenges have been overcome by using cutting edge geospatial, machine learning and big data technologies to drive exceptional quality of service.

In this tech talk, you will learn:

• How Grindr built their backend to handle both predictable and unpredictable loads, including problem detection, failure isolation, deployment and measurement.

• Which technologies are used to architect a highly advanced and complex geo-spatial environment.

• How they optimized resources, including staff and technology services.

Lukas Sliwka, Chief Technical Officer, Grindr


Lukas Sliwka is the CTO at Grindr LLC, responsible for creating a highly effective and innovative engineering organization. He is the catalyst for the team's agile transformation while leading the effort to completely redesign Grindr's global services and mobile client architectures. Lukas evolved Grindr to a highly personalized experience to more than 1 million active hourly users across 196 countries.


Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

Did you know that Techie Youth is the ONE-AND-ONLY organization providing career-opportunities to severely-at-risk foster-youth in New York?

Techie Youth is a 501c3 not-for-profit charity of NYC that provides technology-education, followed by assistance beginning an IT-career, to at-risk youth in NYC & Long Island who are in foster-care and classified as being severely-at-risk of becoming homeless and/or incarcerated in the next 18-24 months.

These kids need YOU, they have nobody else.
Please help them. Learn about Nadine, a student of Techie Youth: http://www.TechieYouth.org/hope

results.description:
Functional Architecture: the Pit of Success

Object-oriented architects and developers have, over the years, learned many hard lessons about successfully designing systems with object-oriented programming. This has led to a plethora of ‘best practices’ that are painfully passed on from older to younger generations via books, lectures, consulting, blog posts, etc. Many of these ‘best practices’ must be explicitly taught, because they don’t evolve naturally from object-oriented programming. Surprisingly, many of these hard-won ‘best practices’ fall naturally into place when applying functional programming. Instead of deliberate design, functional programming forms pits of success where you naturally fall into the same ‘best practices’ that you have to deliberately work for in object-oriented programming. In this session, you’ll learn about a handful of such ‘best practices’, and how functional programming automatically lead you there, without your explicit effort.


A Functional architecture with F#

F# is a Functional language in the .NET framework; while most people still regard it as a niche language, it’s a Turing complete, general purpose language, so you can build almost any sort of application with it. However, with its strong focus on immutability, programmers used to Object Orientation struggle with creating a proper architecture for a Functional system.

One way to approach Functional architecture is to separate the system into abstractions for writing data, and abstractions for reading data.

A set of design patterns collectively known as Pipes and Filters provide a model for receiving and persisting data, while a programming model known as Map/Reduce addresses the concerns of reading (persisted) data and transforming it into useful boundary constructs.


Mark Seemann

Mark Seemann helps programmers make code easier to maintain. His professional interests include functional programming, object-oriented development, software architecture, as well as software development in general. Apart from writing a book about Dependency Injection he has also created several Pluralsight courses, and written numerous articles and blog posts about programming. Originally poised to become a rock star or (failing that) graphic novelist (in the European tradition) he one day found himself with insufficient talent for either, a master’s degree in Economics, and a desire for working with computers. He has been doing the latter intermittently since 1995. When not working with software or spending time with his family, Mark enjoys reading, listening to and playing music, as well as preparing or consuming gourmet food and wine.

Schedule:

6:30 - 7:00 Pizza/Socializing

7:00 - 8:30 Talk

8:30 - ??? Pub Time

results.description:
A favorite at the 2015 Cannes Film Festival, writer-director Jeremy Saulnier's follow-up to his melancholy revenge film Blue Ruin is an exceptionally constructed, ultra-violent horror-thriller -- featuring an unforgettable Patrick Stewart as a ruthless skinhead.

Down-on-their-luck punk rockers The Ain’t Rights (Anton Yelchin, Imogen Poots, and Alia Shawkat) get an unexpected booking at an isolated, run-down club deep in the backwoods of Oregon. While backstage, they witness an act of violence they weren’t meant to see and must face off against the club's brutal owner, Darcy Banker (Stewart), who has them trapped backstage and will do anything to protect the secrets of his nefarious enterprise.

What follows is an unexpected, life-or-death showdown between the hapless band and their captors. Green Room is another masterful spin on genre filmmaking from Saulnier, aided by sharp performances from its cast, feverish sequences of violence, and a wildly chaotic soundtrack of hardcore songs.

The film will be introduced by it's Director, Jeremy Saulnier, and he'll also be there for a special Q&A afterwards!

To buy tickets click here, or go to the following link (no, this isn't a Free Screening - tickets are $11 for all NYC GRINDHOUSE members [usually $14])

www.FilmLinc.org/films/Green-Room


https://youtu.be/Q8XSARX3DQg
results.name: GREEN ROOM - a special advanced screaming hosted by Director Jeremy Saulnier!

results.description:
It's open source, it's geo, it's awesome, it's...desktop GIS!? That's right, you can design amazing maps and conduct deep data analysis right on your own machine- FOR FREE!


Join us as we highlight some of the things we are most excited about when it comes to open source GIS. We'll dive into some of the features and plugins that make QGIS so awesome, and open it up for lighting talks for anyone who has a testimony of how QGIS makes their geo-lives easier. If you don't have QGIS installed yet, this would be an excellent time to get started.

If there's a QGIS feature or plugin you'd like to share, comment below to let others know what you'll talk about! Plan on talking for up to five minutes.


We'll also have time after the QGIS lovefest to work on projects and any geo-questions you have, so please bring them!

As usual, pizza and beer will be provided by our gracious hosts.
results.name: For the Love of QGIS

results.description:
Click the link below to officially reserve a spot on this event:


http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-behind-the-scenes-the-new-york-society-library-tickets-23803307333?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club for a behind-the-scenes tour @ The New York Society Library (NYSL), the oldest cultural institution in New York City at 262 years old.

Our experience at the historic 1917 John S. Rogers Italianate town house, the NYSL's fourth location, will include:

·        A brief introduction to the Library’s history, impact, and current operations

·        A walk through the major public and members-only spaces, including the Children’s Library and writers’ rooms

·        An exclusive peek at selected rare books with the Rare Book Librarian

·        A detailed look at the current exhibition with the library's Head of Exhibitions

Afterwards, we'll head to a local eatery for some more food and drinks!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Behind-the-Scenes @ The New York Society Library

results.description:
It's Spring! Time to come together and connect over a drink or two and catch everyone up on what you've been up to.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Our tours are designed for people who live work and play in NYC, not tourists.  They are meant to open your eyes to the things that you may walk past everyday and never realize what you are passing by! If you are a native New Yorker or new to the city there is so much we take for granted, so much history, hidden secrets and fun facts that await you when you join us and explore and socialize with other fun people from NYSN and the other social groups participating!

We begin near Penn Station then go through Herald Square, The edge of Times Square and end at Bryant Park.  From there you have the option to join us for our weekly Happy Hour at The Playwright Tavern a few blocks away. You will be amazed at the amount of history and hidden things you will see along the way.  Your tour guide will show you pictures from the late 18 and early 1900’s plus share the historical significances of each location.  The tour lasts about 90 minutes.

What to wear: Dress casual/business casual. Wear comfortable shoes

What to Bring: maybe a bottle of water for the walk and your sense of adventure!

What to Expect: 15-25 fun and friendly people who are looking to make new friends and learn a little about the city

How do I pay?  *** Please bring exact change $15 ***

What if it rains? We will send an email update by 2pm the day of the tour

Meet at The Thirsty Fan Tavern across from Madison Square Garden on 31st and 8th from 6-6:30pm for a cocktail.  The tour leaves at 6:30pm
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorkers: Midtown History & Secrets 34th-42nd Street + Cocktails

results.description:
At times, finding or maintaining a positive self-image can be difficult. We are living in a unique time where dwindling confidence can be the result of social media, unrealistic expectations, life's hardships and more. Or perhaps you never quite found that confidence you've been searching for.

Self-esteem also has a direct relationship to our individual happiness. Improving your self-image can benefit you outwardly in your career, relationships and more; as well as allowing you to feel better and happier overall.

Please join me as we work on a different piece of the self-esteem puzzle each week, in addition to supporting you as you work through your specific roadblock(s). Whether you can attend one meeting or the whole series, I'm certain you will benefit from the work we do together!

Our focus for 3/29/16: Addressing negative self-talk

4/5/16: Taking inventory of your best qualities

4/12/16: Making personal improvements

Be sure to RSVP if you plan on attending.
results.name: Confidence Building

group.name: New York Coffee and Coaching Meetup

results.description:
Let's talk wearables with some of the best in the biz! 

We have three of NYC's smartest people on deck to share their stories, answer your questions, and drop some serious knowledge. 

PANELISTS ::

Christina d'Avignon // Founder, Ringly 

Sara Chipps // CEO, Jewelbots 

Josh Clark // Principal, Big Medium; author of 5 books including the new Designing for Touch; wearable tech interface designer 

Moderator: Liza Kindred // Founder, Third Wave Fashion

EVENT DETAILS ::

Tuesday, March 29th, 2016 

6:30 pm - 8:30 pm 

Panel from 7-8 pm, networking, drinks, & snacks before + after. 

$20 and space is limited, so be sure to RSVP quickly. 

LOCATION ::


Our new partners at Alley will be hosting us in their brand spanking new Chelsea location: 119 West 24th Street, 4th Floor (between 6th + 7th Ave.) 

Please note: This is not the same space as last time–it's in their new Chelsea location. 

See you there! 

xo

Liza & The Third Wave Fashion team
results.how_to_find_us: 119 West 24th Street between 6th + 7th Ave in Chelsea // Take the elevator to the 4th floor!
results.name: NYC: Wearable Tech Panel

results.description:
This month, we'll explore how analaytics services and IBM Watson are used to enrich and monitor data from devices and gateways, visualize what’s happening, and respond to emerging conditions through automated actions.

We'll be joined by Bruce Weed, the city leader (New York and Boston) for IBM’s Cloud/Cognitive business development with startups and entrepreneurs. In addition, his team works with enterprise developers. Bruce's focus and expertise are around Watson, IoT, Big Data, Cloud and Blockchain.

Agenda:

• 6:30-7pm: Sign-in, food/drink and discussion

• 7-7:15: Welcome, topic intro, member announcements/asks [Linda Drabik, organizer IoT NY meetup]

• 7:15-8:15pm: Speaker presentation & Q&A [Bruce Weed, IBM Watson]

• 8:30pm: Event wraps up
results.name: IoT NY # 29, Cognitive Services, my dear Watson

results.description: Interested in helping plan and set the vision for Agtech NYC, developing industry connections, and growing the overall reach of our space? Agtech NYC is looking for organizers, planners, advisors, and committee members. We have a backlog of event ideas, potential speakers, leads, contacts, and partners. Please join us for an evening of networking, planning, and visioning!
results.name: Agtech NYC - Spring Planning

results.description:
Join stenographers, translators and technologists at 6:30 p.m. on March 29 for a discussion about creating stories and news applications in multiple languages. Panelists include Millie Tran (Director of Global Adaptation, Buzzfeed), Sisi Wei (investigative reporter and developer, ProPublica) and stenographer Mirabai Knight.

Schedule:

6:30 p.m.: Doors, dinner + socializing

7 p.m.: Panel discussion with Mirabai Knight, Millie Tran and Sisi Wei

~8:00 p.m.: Hiring announcements, networking and socializing

To attend the March 29 Hacks/Hackers NYC meetup on "Translation, Transcription & Reaching the Public," RSVP today ($10, payable in advance) to Hacks/Hackers NYC.

Refund policy: Cancel at least 24 hours before the event (that is, no later than 6:30 p.m. March 28) to receive a full refund. We cannot issue refunds after March 28.

A big thanks to Postlight for hosting us this month!

Postlight is a new company with deep roots in New York City. Our founders, Rich Ziade and Paul Ford, have worked together for years. We have an extraordinary team of people who love to create software, many of whom have also worked together for years. Comprised of product strategists, designers, and engineers, we are committed to building and shipping great technology products. Tell us where you need to be and we'll get you there fast.
results.name: Translation, Transcription & Working with Multiple Languages

results.description:
You don't need a mat!

Start Up Yoga is a pop-up yoga experience, providing mobile yoga sessions throughout New York City. We invite you to breathe, meditate and flow with us. Our novice to advanced classes can be conveniently found in spaces in your neighborhood including parks, office spaces, rooftops and art galleries.


60 Minute Revitalize


Carve out the time to unite your breath to your body. Synergize through dynamic movements and conscious breathing. This experience is enhanced with aromatherapy oils and hands on assistance to support postural alignment.
results.name: StartUp Yoga - Sweat, Heal, and Meditate!

results.description:
DACC SOFT OPENING EVENT

BLACKDOVE: COLLECTING ART WITH THE ONLINE MARKETPLACE

Admission: Free

Schedule

6:30-7:00pm - DACC Soft Opening

7:00-8:30pm - DACC INTERVIEW | Q & A

8:30-9:00PM - DACC YOUR ATTENTION MOMENT

After 9:00pm - Networking


DACC INTERVIEW


• Marisa Terrizzi, co-founder, Blackdove

• Joseph Kraeutler, art dealer and Fine Art Division Lead, Blackdove

https://vimeo.com/143663529

Share with Marisa Terrizzi and Joseph Kraeutler the background stories of the earliest online marketplace for digital art collection in the U.S. Learn how to collect the world's best digital art with the online marketplace and from your mobile phone!

DACC YOUR ATTENTION MOMENT


• Carla Gannis, artist and Assistant Chairperson of Digital Arts, Pratt Institute

https://vimeo.com/157516746

[Video courtesy Transfer Gallery, Brooklyn, opening of "A Subject Self-Defined," a solo exhibition from Carla Gannis, Jan.23-Mar.12, 2016 | Filmed by: Ray Tee]

One of the most powerful figures in New York digital art scene. Gannis narrates through a "digital looking glass" where reflection on power, sexuality, marginalization, and agency often emerge. She is fascinated by contemporary modes of digital communication, the power (and sometimes the perversity) of popular iconography, and the situation of identity in the blurring contexts of technological virtuality and biological reality. (Artist's statement on carlagannis.com)


Venue sponsor

Little Water Radio New York

Broadcasting | Media production | Performance
results.name: Blackdove: Collecting art with the online marketplace

results.description:
Join us for an incredible private wine tasting with several different social groups. We will meet in a private wine cellar and taste wines from all over the world. We will have both red and white wines along with light appetizers.

There will also be detailed written tasting notes and the ability to purchase similar wines in an adjacent wine store at a special discount.

If you're new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all. This is such a fun wine tasting that sells out every time!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Mar-29-2016_at_0630PM

Tickets start are just $35 (goes to $45 as event gets closer). This event sells out every time so don't wait to get tickets. 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% will attend on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work. It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Why does your RSVP say +25? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 25+ members attending! 

What are the ages? This is non-age specific event and is not meant to be gender balanced. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Mar-29-2016_at_0630PM
results.name: Private Wine Tasting w/ Appetizers (PREPAY ONLY)

What are the ages? This is non-age specific event and is not meant to be gender balanced. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Mar-29-2016_at_0630PM
results.name: Private Wine Tasting w/ Appetizers (PREPAY ONLY)

results.description:
Join us for an incredible private wine tasting with several different social groups. We will meet in a private wine cellar and taste wines from all over the world. We will have both red and white wines along with light appetizers.

There will also be detailed written tasting notes and the ability to purchase similar wines in an adjacent wine store at a special discount.

If you're new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all. This is such a fun wine tasting that sells out every time!

results.description:
Come and explore the underutilized and often overlooked functions of one of the most powerful remote control tools you’ll ever use. From encrypting your web and file transfer traffic to laughing in the faces of common firewalls, SSH will be your network-bending magic wand. Take this knowledge, it’s dangerous to go alone.

Alex Flores is a former Dev Bootcamp instructor and a SysAdmin turned developer from San Francisco. When he’s not coding at work, he’s coding at home. Usually connecting devices that ought not know about each other which I suppose makes him an unwitting contributor to the technological singularity. On the side, he’s also a drummer, gamer, coffee-lover and all-around dweeb. Don’t talk about Star Wars if you want to get home at a reasonable hour.
results.name: What the SSHell?! A talk about a powerful tool for developers with Alex Flores

group.name: The New York City Social Group (12,000+ members!)

results.description:
Meet us on the last Tuesday of the Month to learn, discuss and practice Business Model Generation (BMG), the Canvas, a little bit of Lean Startup and overall business common sense.

This methodology is a simple way to get a high level view of your current or future business and understand how each part of it integrates and interacts with the others. We use the Canvas, a simple diagram, to map these parts and interactions.

While fairly simple, this methodology is a very powerful tool.

You can learn more about the book, methodology, author, and the Canvas :

>> here << 

See you all then !

Dan & Stephen.
results.how_to_find_us: Find us in the Meeting room on the left as you enter.
results.name: Free : Intro to BMG + Workshop!

results.description:
Join for the March NY Finance, Trading & Banking Professional Networking Session. Meet the diverse mix of  finance professionals from different/various career levels.  

We will have a restricted area for our members only. Cash bar, pay for what you order. Happy hour prices till 8:00 pm.


Attendees include but not limited to:

• Portfolio Managers

•  M & A Analysts 

•  Research Analysts (Buy / Sell Side)

•  MBA Candidates

•  Hedge Fund Service Providers 

•  Equity And Derivative Traders

•  Prime Brokerage Professionals 

•  Fund Administration Professionals

•  Operational Specialists.

•  Finance & Accounting Recruiters and HR Professionals.


Attire – We always recommend to wear business casuals but not mandatory. 

How it would work: · 


• Receive name tag upon arrival. Clearly mention your name and your area of work/interest. · 

• The host will guide you to the main area. · 

• Connect and network with other professionals in a relaxed yet focused environment.  


The event focus on creating long term professional relationship with experienced finance experts. The networking event will help in building social capital among the members of finance community on an ongoing basis.

Meetup takes place on a weekday right after work in a relaxed atmosphere conducive to making connections.

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your NEW YEAR with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
For our next meetup, we are pleased to welcome Datadog data scientist Homin Lee! Homin will be discussing how he and his colleagues have implemented systems for outlier and anomaly detection in real-time.

Datadog is a monitoring service that collects and processes hundreds of billions of data points every day from web servers, databases, cloud providers, and other infrastructural components. Outlier and anomaly detection helps users make sense of the flood of data coming from their systems and to identify deviations from normal levels, even when "normal" fluctuates over time.

Homin will discuss the lessons that his team has learned from using these alerts on their own systems, along with some real-life examples on how to avoid false positives and negatives.

Thanks to Datadog for sponsoring a taco bar, beers, and soft drinks at this meetup. They will also be on hand to collect entries for a post-meetup raffle. One lucky attendee will win an Apple Watch!
results.name: Detecting Anomalies and Outliers in Real-Time

Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
How often do we take the time to really focus on releasing all the tension and stress that we accumulate in our body?

Not very.

Instead, we just keep on trucking, hoping it all will magically disappear.

But we know that won't be the case unless we do something about it.

Enter Osho's powerful Kundalini meditation, a kind of active meditation specifically designed for modern life that helps us to release stress and unblock our energy.

Comprised of 15 minutes of shaking, 15 minutes of dancing, 15 minutes of stillness (sitting or standing), and 15 minutes of silence (shavasana), this meditation is a really amazing way to shake everything off, get past self-doubts and limiting beliefs.

Because it's both invigorating and relaxing, it gets us out of our mind and reminds us of how incredibly good being an embodied being can feel like when we get out of our way.

This practice creates a release of pent up emotions, tension and blockages in the body, and it's energizing, uplifting and calming at the same time. It's often a really amazing way to make room for inspiration because once those doubts are removed, creativity flows like whoa!


Join us every other Tuesday as we shake it all off, and leave it on the floor.


Shake It All Off! Active Meditation for Tension Release and Well-Being

Every other Tuesday, 7-8:30 pm

27 W 24th Street, 7th floor, Suite 700A (Manhattan)

$15 donation / $20 for 2 if you bring a friend

Register


NOTE: in order to cover costs, this event requires at least 5 people to be signed up per date 24 hrs prior for it to happen. Please RSVP mindfully so I know what size room to book for us in advance.



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


"After attending Melody’s “Shake It Off” and “Embodiment” workshops, not only was my personal way of relating to my physical, mental, and spiritual enhanced, but it motivated me to seek out entire aspects of the human condition that have supported my growth as a social worker deeply. Prior to working with Melody, I had been enamored with the mind and aspects of intelligence that caused me to completely disconnect from my body; I did not take care of it, and it did not take care of me. I feel so fortunate to have experientially learned with Melody’s guidance, that the body holds many of the keys to inner peace, whether for my self or my clients."

Abbi K., New York, NY


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MELODY KIERSZ

Melody Kiersz wants you to stop trying to prove yourself worthy and start living the life that makes you happy.

Melody holds a degree in Happiness from the prestigious New York University, is a Certified Holistic Health Counselor graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, a member of the American Association of Drugless Practitioners, and a Certified Yoga Teacher through Jungle Yoga Ashram.

Melody is a deep listener and reads between the lines to guide you in discovering the ways you're holding yourself back from your true expression. She specializes in healing our relationship with our bodies, our selves and others, improving body image and self-esteem, increasing our ability to speak up, share, and allow ourselves to be seen and loved as we are. As the Founder of Naked Wellness, her goal is to guide you as you peel all those layers of resistance so you can turn yourself on for a life full of health, passion, power, freedom, joy and pleasure.

Based in New York City, Melody offers in-person and long-distance private sessions, and is really passionate about everyone really getting that they are absolutely perfect exactly as they are.

She can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>.

results.description:
Gene Murrow and Tom Amessé will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by Barb Seppeler and Laurie Williams!

The fifth Playford Ball prep session will also be featured in the dance selection tonight.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: English Country Dance with Gene Murrow and Tom Amessé

results.description:
We are grateful for those who could attend last night. We had a very deep conversation regarding the Crucifixion and Resurrection. Please RSVP before Monday, 3/28 to attend our next talk regarding True Prayer.

While many of us pray, meditate, visualize, etc. we rarely think about what true prayer is. What is a true prayer? What are we "asking for" in true prayer?

From the "Song of Prayer" (free to read online)


"Prayer is a way offered by the Holy Spirit to reach God. It is not merely a question or an entreaty. It cannot succeed until you realize that it asks for nothing. How else could it serve its purpose? It is impossible to pray for idols and hope to reach God. True prayer must avoid the pitfall of asking to entreat. Ask, rather, to receive what is already given; to accept what is already there. 

We hope you'll join us on Tuesday at 7pm to share ideas about true prayer and to "recieve what is already given." 

Happy Easter to all
results.name: ACIM - True Prayer

results.description:
Evernote is an ever-ready, note-taking application for your computer, phone and tablet. This enables to you not only capture information rapidly as it comes to you in virtually any format, but also recall it when you need it. This new productivity workflow can be amazing for getting a hold on your paper management and moving toward a paperless lifestyle.

Can it be done? Let’s learn about going paperless with Evernote with someone who’s done it, editor-in-chief of LegalProductivity.com and Content Manager for RocketMatter (legal practice management software), Tim Baran!

On March 29, 2016 at 7pm EDT, Tim will cover the strategies and techniques he uses in going and staying paperless with Evernote. We will be broadcasting the presentation via Blab.im. (It’s free and no login is required to watch. If you wish to chat or ask questions, you need to login and that simply requires a free Twitter account.) 

Please visit https://goo.gl/rFkSI5 on March 29, 2016 at 7pm EDT and join us for “Going Paperless with Evernote," presented by Tim Baran, LegalProductivity.com!


                                 https://goo.gl/rFkSI5

Hosted by Evernote DC - Penny Bryant Catterall, Order Your Life and Ray Sidney-Smith, Evernote Business Certified Consultant

results.description:
Join us at YM Monthly - a monthly initiative to introduce Young Members to each of the outdoor activities offered by AMC's New York-North Jersey Chapter. Each month, the Young Members Committee partners with one of the eight activity committees within our chapter. An experienced leader from that committee organizes a fun and educational excursion for Young Members of all skill levels - from the beginner exploring a new hobby to the seasoned veteran interested in volunteering as a leader. Past YM Monthly included a snowshoeing and bird watching event with the Hiking Committee.

The YM Monthly for March 2016 will be organized by the Canoe & Kayak Committee:

We'll meet for a whitewater paddling/training session at NJIT pool (indoor). The session is suitable for beginner to advanced paddlers. Kayaks, canoe and gear will be provided. Bring towel, swimsuit, and lock. Take Path train to Newark $2.75 (can use metro card- not monthly), then downstairs to light rail ($0.70) 3 stops to Warren Street - exit is right in front of Fleisher Building where pool is at.

Spots are limited. Please register by emailing Katharina Flenker by Wednesday March 23.
results.name: YM Monthly - Paddling session with the Canoe and Kayak Commitee

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.


If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.

Hello Group! We have some fantastic content for our March MeetUp:

1. 360 Video - A group member is working on his thesis at NYU incorporating 360 degree spherical experiences in a constructed 3D environment (outer space). I've seen the demo and it's awesome! Lots to talk about with this emerging technology.

2. Collaborative Workflow in Adobe Premiere - A group member is assisting on a Premiere Pro documentary and seeks guidance about how to create/manage a collaborative environment with traditional Premiere Pro licenses. Another group members seeks to create a similar setup in a video marketing / industrial environment.

3. "Post-Production Personalities" - This should be fun! A group member would like to hear experiences in post working with... interesting people. A great editor is often a diplomat, right? Tricky topic.

We'll discuss each topic above for 15 minutes (7:00 -7:45) then open it up until 8:30. From 8:30 to 9:00 we'll end the structured part of the meeting so people can chat.

Please call/email with any suggestions or questions.

Thank you!
TJ Daly

Our usual bi-weekly volunteer meeting will be replaced this week by a forum in Brooklyn. Sane Energy Project Co-Director Kim Fraczek will be a guest speaker, along with Labor advocate Sean Sweeney, to lead a discussion about resistance to the entwined forces of government agencies and fossil fuel industries. 

Kim will talk about the ongoing ResistAIM campaign and her experience as one of the blockaders arrested attempting to halt construction on the Spectra pipeline that could run dangerously close to Indian Point. Most recently, 27 residents took part in an action on March 23rd (see photo below). 

The event is free and donations are welcome. 

Sane's usual meetings will return to Patagonia in 2 weeks.

results.description:
<a>​</a>“It’s a decopunk alt-history Hollywood space opera mystery thriller. With space whales.” - Catherynne M. Valente

Cat Valente will be a guest of honor at this year's Readercon. Between now and July, we'll be exploring recent works created by Readercon guests so we can confidently engage with these authors when we attend the con.

From Goodreads:

"Radiance is a decopunk pulp SF alt-history space opera mystery set in a Hollywood—and solar system—very different from our own, from the phenomenal talent behind the New York Times bestselling The Girl Who Circumnavigated Fairyland in a Ship of Her Own Making.

Severin Unck’s father is a famous director of Gothic romances in an alternate 1986 in which talking movies are still a daring innovation due to the patent-hoarding Edison family. Rebelling against her father’s films of passion, intrigue, and spirits from beyond, Severin starts making documentaries, traveling through space and investigating the levitator cults of Neptune and the lawless saloons of Mars. For this is not our solar system, but one drawn from classic science fiction in which all the planets are inhabited and we travel through space on beautiful rockets. Severin is a realist in a fantastic universe.

But her latest film, which investigates the disappearance of a diving colony on a watery Venus populated by island-sized alien creatures, will be her last. Though her crew limps home to earth and her story is preserved by the colony’s last survivor, Severin will never return.

Aesthetically recalling A Trip to the Moon and House of Leaves, and told using techniques from reality TV, classic film, gossip magazines, and meta-fictional narrative, Radiance is a solar system-spanning story of love, exploration, family, loss, quantum physics, and silent film."

Some questions to consider while reading:

The author claims, in an interview with John Scalzi, that the book has not one big idea, but six. Do you agree? Can you identify the big idea(s)?

This is a VERY alternate Earth the author is positing. What do you think of the setting? Is it plausible? Does plausibility even matter in this context? Why or why not?

This author frequently writes for a young adult, and sometimes younger, audience. Is that obvious that this author writes for both young and adult audiences? Does this feel like an “adult” novel?

This book is a sort of multi-media novel in written form including, in the author’s words, “including scripts, audio, shifting POV, and the other ephemera and metafictional elements.” Is this strategy successful? How do these elements contribute to or enhance the reading experience?

Also, keep an eye on all the standard elements. How do the characters strike you? Do you like them? How does your impression of the characters affect your experience with the book? Keep an eye on pacing, how the chapters are broken, and how these elements keep you interested (or leave you with the urge to skim) while reading this book.

results.name: Book Discussion Group: ​ Radiance by Catherynne M. Valente

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
What will our cities look like in 50 years? How will they work? What technologies will we be using?

These are questions that our guest, Gray Scott, has dedicated his life, business, and career to. At this week's meetup, we'll be diving into questions and topics surrounding urban sustainability, architecture, and lifestyle, with Gray leading an in-depth discussion.

We'll be learning about upcoming innovations and expected breakthroughs in the following areas:

• Biomimetic Design 

• Atmospheric Water Harvesting 

• Desalination 

• Pink LED Vertical Farming 

• Kinetic energy harvesting in urban areas 

• 3D Printed housing 

• Solar Fiberoptic Lighting

We're excited to have Gray at this week's meetup! Since we're just finishing up the March Urban Farming challenge, this final meetup of the month will be the perfect sign-off for what's proven to be an exciting industry of opportunity!

We'll be lining up a larger venue shortly so secure your RSVP to receive updates. 

If you have questions for Gray or general topics of discussion that you'd like included in the meetup or Q&A, post them in the comments below.

See you Tuesday!

-Dan & the Think Tank Team (Mikayla, Kevin, Mike, and Brendan)

About Your Presenter: Gray Scott

Gray Scott is a futurist and one of the world’s leading experts in the field of emerging technology. He is the founder and CEO of SeriousWonder.com and a professional member of The World Future Society.

Gray has frequently appeared on and been interviewed by the Discovery Channel, CBS News, VICE MOTHERBOARD, Al Jazeera America, The Washington Post, and Psychology Today. 

We're excited to welcome Gray as a guest in this week's Think Tank!

Sponsored By The Sodality

It doesn’t matter if you’re a student, a teacher, a rocket scientist, a real estate broker, a venture capitalist, a serial entrepreneur, or hold any other area of expertise… Saying “I want to improve the future” isn’t typically considered part of a normal conversation, so it becomes a better option to keep it to yourself. 

The Sodality was born out of this challenge. We’re a close-knit family of tech enthusiasts, entrepreneurs, and investors who deeply believe that an individual can enact massive change in the world, especially when aided by a family which is driven by the same mission. 

To learn more, attend Tuesday's event. More information will be provided in person!

results.name: Gray Scott on How We'll Build a Future of Urban Sustainability

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Chartbeat


Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Love Exchange is $30 per person, or $75 per threesome
Please RSVP HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/navigating-successful-3ways-wlive-laboratory-new-yorks-first-3way-puja-tickets-20202161208
Three doesn’t necessarily have to be a crowd… Let Reid show you how!
It’s a popular fantasy with twice the pleasure potential, but navigating a three-way romance (if only for one night) can be tricky.

Join world renowned sex and relationship educator Reid Mihalko for this, fun-filled, 1.5 hr workshop (with live demonstrations!)

Not only will you get a chance to ask questions, but we’ll cover:

What are the best techniques to satisfy two lovers at once?
Ways to overcome fears and concerns – Yours AND your partner’s!
The most common threesome mistakes (and how to avoid them!)
How to negotiate boundaries and safer sex protocols to make your next menage a trios tré bien!
Whether you’ve had more threesomes than Jim Morrison or are just beginning to consider three-in-a-bed might be something you’d like to explore, this workshop will give you plenty of tools, tricks, perspectives and laughs to enhance your love life and strengthen your relationships!

Even if you would NEVER be interested in a 3-way, this fun-filled class will give you lots of ways to talk to your loved ones about the things you DO WANT in the bedroom – no matter how tame or outrageous!

Bring your loved ones, bring your friends, and enjoy an educational and entertaining evening on how to successfully navigate one of the most common sexual fantasies: the threesome!

The second half of this class, you will get to break out into threesome pods, Monique will lead you through different connection exercises where you will get to practice, in real time, what Reid just offered you about navigating this tricky territory.

This will be New York's first 3way puja, where you can come with a couple of partners and do all the negotiated exercises with one another, or you can choose to rotate through the room, where at each station (Exercise) you will have a chance to interact with 2 new partners. This is an excellent safe fully clothed structured space, for you to get move through the potential awkward moments of a three or moresome, so if you ever decide you want to try one later, you will have practiced those muscles necessary to more successfully navigate those waters.
Plus it will just be a fun, connective, humorous evening, where in we get permission to laugh at ourselves, to not have to "get it right" as you dare to try out something new.


Love Exchange is $30 per person, or $75 per threesome
Please RSVP HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/navigating-successful-3ways-wlive-laboratory-new-yorks-first-3way-puja-tickets-20202161208


ABOUT YOUR FACILITATORS:
Reid Mihalko of www.ReidAboutSex.com helps people create more self-esteem and greater health in their relationship and sex lives, no matter what their self-expression of those happen to be.

Reid has worked with thousands of individuals from myriad walks of life, orientations, relationship styles, countries and religions. Known for his charisma, wit and emphasis on integrity, Reid travels the country teaching, coaching, consulting and collaborating. He has been a writer and producer on a number of films and television projects about sex and relationships, and appears regularly in the media.

Reid has been a featured speaker at dozens of conferences on relationships and sexuality. He has also appeared on the Emmy award-winning talk show Montel, Fox News, VH1’s Scott Baio is 45 and Single, Showtime’s Penn & Teller’s Bulls**t!, Canada’s The Sex Files and SexTV, and the short-lived Life & Style, on NPR, Sirius’ Maxim Radio and Cosmo Radio, and in Marie Claire, GQ, Details, People, Newsweek and The National Enquirer, as well as media across the globe in thirteen countries and at least seven languages.

Monique Darling, workshop facilitator extraordinaire has led over 800 workshops in the past 5 years. She is the founder of Juicy Enlightenment an organization dedicated to empowering people who are questioning the assumptions of how their life should be and to offering tools for self expression that create trust, inner knowing and wisdom to enjoy the life they have. Monique has been featured on TLC and The Dr’s as well as various radio shows, podcasts and magazines across the USA. She specializes in helping others reclaim their power and natural sensuality by transmuting fear and repression into courage, self-love and freedom. Her primary purpose is helping folks bring out their vulnerability, energetic embodiment and fearless relating.She guides from a place of understanding and her natural exuberance is infectious! She is available for private sessions, experiential workshops and Cuddle Parties. Learn more about Monique by going to juicyenlightenment.com or track her whereabouts at whereintheworldismoniquedarling.com
results.name: Navigating Successful Threeways with Reid Mihalko and Monique Darling

results.description:
Everyone said they had a good time, so let's do it again.

If you're  looking to get out and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.

We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try. And if you're coming right from work The Garth Road Inn does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.

The Garth Road Inn has been serving the Scarsdale community for many years.  It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.


**There will be a prize for the winning team!**


And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!

Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*

There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****


And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Mike when you arrive.
results.name: Trivia Quiz Night @ The Garth Road Inn in Scarsdale

results.description:
Learn & Sweat Bhangra sessions are for you 

- if you love to sweat it out to heart pumping music


- if you think fitness doesn't mean lifting weights

- if you want to learn and groove to energetic Bhangra while burning serious cals.

The class begins with a warm up, high energy and high fun, this Bhangra class combines the strong, festive moves of traditional Bhangra dance with a follow-me fitness-class style. 

Each week participants also have the opportunity to learn a more in-depth piece of Bhangra choreography to a popular dance floor hit. 

If you love Bhangra music and you’re looking for a fun, unique way to keep fit, join us to sweat it out while partying to the beats.

No previous dance experience is necessary - just bring in your smile! Our Instructors are professional, friendly, and open minded. So come on in and let swag emerge!

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

The drop-in price is $20 and can be paid here on meetup, or head over to our website www.nycbhangra.com/nycbhangra/signup for other options to pay.

Checkout our BEGINNER BHANGRA classes too!
results.name: Learn & Sweat BHANGRA

-Students that want to improve their speaking & pronunciation

-Listening: Definitions, Vocabulary, Synonyms

Please only sign up if you are serious about attending, we remove members that do not honor their RSVP!

results.description:
Civil disobedience ( cd ) is an American tradition going back to before the American Revolution in 1776. When people feel the law is on the wrong side, it is their duty to change it and until it is changed, oppose it. I have two guests who have been involved with doing cd.

On Dec. 12, when the second Indian Point nuclear reactor started operating without a license, and the government agency charged with regulating the nuclear industry, the NRC, allowed it to operate anyway, 11 people blockaded the plant until they were arrested. During the trial, they pleaded "guilty and proud of it."

Sally Gellert was one of the 11. She's from New Jersey, is a member of the Indian Point Safe Energy Coalition and the Stony Point Convergence and is an organizer of the Safe Energy Summit on April 29-May 1. (Which we hope you will attend. For more information on that, go to http://stonypointcenter.org/get-involved/latest-news/228-safeenergy0116 .)

Nancy Vann is a landowner in Westchester County of property that the Spectra Pipeline Co. took via eminent domain to build the Algonquin Pipeline Extension, a larger-than-usual high pressure methane pipeline (marketed as "natural gas.") being built to bring fracked methane to the Atlantic coast to be liquified and exported to Europe and Asia. Nancy was dragged from her seat at a FERC meeting and onto the floor (FERC is the federal agency that approves all the interstate pipeline projects). Nancy is president of a local Safe Energy Rights group and a member of Resist AIM, https://resistaim.wordpress.com/
Tune in to listen to these two heroines tell their stories.

WBAI, 99.5FM & www.wbai.org
results.name: Eco-cd at I.P. and AIM radio with participants Tues. 3/29/16

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This is an absentee / distant / remote meetup where members can receive therapeutic energy from the comfort of their own home.

INVITATION & INFO

This note invites you and reminds previous participants to our weekly Energy Flux group on Tuesday nights.  Some of you may wish to include a friend or situation that you have a concern about to this group  as well (see instructions below).

You can participate wherever you happen to be at 9 pm.  PLEASE RSVP BY 8:30 PM EDT TUESDAY, IF YOU'D LIKE TO JOIN OR REMAIN.  Your response means you're aware of facilitating a growth and/or healing issue.  You may also participate for enjoyment, relaxation and general therapeutic effect.  You can request to participate for a longer period, e.g., an entire season or number of months.

If you can not reply until after 8:30 please join in anyhow and tell me afterwards.  This group is organized on weekly basis with reminders.

If you stop RSVP-ing you will not be included on the Energy Flux after a month (something good may have happened when we forget)!  Either way feedback is welcome (many fascinating and  wonderful accounts of our activity).

Besides Tuesday night, I may tune into this list as guided during various other times, some of which may be announced.  The therapeutic energy is universal and multi-modal (synthesizing a personal energy based modality, Reiki, TT, etc.).

INSTRUCTIONS

Short and simple intructions will be emailed to you after an RSVP is received.

$12 suggested donation.  Participants may contribute more or less based on their lifestyle.  Larger donations naturally support those with less financial resources and the continuation of Unu's activities.
results.why: We receive enjoyment, relaxation and general therapeutic feeling and healing through Energy Flux.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
A Mid-Marriage Agreement is a contract that defines how assets and support will be dealt with upon a couples’ divorce and is voluntarily entered into after a marriage has occurred.  It is different that a pre-nuptial agreement in that a marriage already has taken place before the agreement has been executed.  Join us as Steven M. Segalas, Certified Matrimonial Attorney and Partner at Damiano Law, will discuss what can and can’t be included in the agreement.  Mr. Segalas is a knowledgeable family law attorney has been practicing since 1997 and been recognized by Super Lawyers as a Rising Star.  Reasons for a mid-marriage agreement might include:

One spouse believes the marriage is unstable

Update or modify an existing pre-nuptial agreement

Provide for children of a prior marriage

Provide protection to business partners of one of the spouses from a parties’ divorce.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on March 30th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
Hello Business Professional! 

If you are a business professional in the Bellmore, NY area and are looking to grow your business, as well as increase your network of businesses that you can trust and rely on look no further than Simply Referrals! 

Simply Referrals is the type of business networking group that is all about developing long-lasting relationships, as opposed to contracts, and membership fees and ultimatums that other groups have. S.R. has no contracts, no fees, and no nonsense. A membership cannot be purchased. Simply Referrals is also an exclusive membership, which means you will be the only one from your respective profession. 


Spots are filling fast so don't delay! 

S.R. is a true network of business professionals that you can trust. Our #1 goal is to develop a team of businesses that not only its members can trust to refer and work with, but a team of businesses that can be counted on by local businesses, family, and friends to always act in good faith, and always do the right thing. If Simply Referrals sounds like a business networking group that you would like to be a part of, please see us at our next meeting! 

Next meetings are scheduled for 3/30 and 4/20. 

Regular meetings are approximately every 3 weeks, and held Wednesday mornings at 7:00 a.m. If you have any questions please email or call at[masked]-1691. 

Please find Simply Referrals Bellmore on Facebook! 

https://www.facebook.com/simply.referrals.bellmore/

If you have a facebook business pg. please tell us! We would love to share your posts and blogs. 


Thank you, 


Steven Bellafiore
Simply Referrals
[masked]

results.description:
PLEASE REGISTER AT THE UX STRAT NEW YORK CITY EVENTBRITE PAGE

The UX Strategy Workshop is a one-day practical workshop on the topic of User Experience (UX) Strategy. UX Strategy Workshops are for UX / CX professionals, product team members, researchers, and business executives who want to learn how to formulate or guide a user experience design strategy, and how to communicate it effectively to their organizations.

Topics covered in this one-day workshop include:

• Moving from tactical to strategic UX design

• Aligning experience design with your company’s business strategy

• Creating a data-driven user model

• Experience mapping

• Design thinking for feature set innovation

• Creating an experience design strategy

• Communicating your UX strategy to executives, partners, and your team

The UX Strategy Workshop is facilitated by Paul Bryan, organizer of the UX STRAT conferences on UX Strategy in Europe and the USA. 

The New York City UX Strategy Workshop is being hosted by Motivate Design, and will be held in their Manhattan office: 111 John St., Suite 450, New York, NY, 10038.

The NYC UX Strategy Workshop will begin promptly at 9 a.m. and will end at 5 p.m. Coffee will be served prior to and during the workshop. Lunch will be provided by our host, Motivate Design. Please bring your Eventbrite ticket to the event to validate your registration. Please note: This registration is only valid for the NYC workshop on March 30, 2016; it cannot be transferred to another workshop or other UX STRAT event in another city or another date.
results.name: Suggested Event: UX STRAT Workshop
