Chair yoga allows students to practice yoga from a chair. This method allows students to practice safely seated, kneeling at the front of the chair (if allowable), and standing at the back of the chair.

 Sessions are created to promote comfort, yet allowing students to increase their limits, and build strength, flexibility, better joint mobility, agility, and balance.

Recommendations:

Dress comfortably and in layers. You will sweat. Bring bottled water to hydrate. please refrain from eating one hour prior to class.

Any questions or concerns can be addressed before, or after class.

WALK IN'S ARE WELCOME

Fee $12 , and $10 for those 65 years and older.

results.description:
THE HIKE IS ON, DESPITE A LOCAL BRUSH FIRE LAST NIGHT.

There is a wait list for this event.  To avoid the need to register for most events, you can join the TriState Ramblers Club for $15 a year, giving you access to a FULLER SCHEDULE of hikes, bike rides, and canoeing events 6 days a week, all year long.  Membership applications can be downloaded from the club website at http://tsr.nynjtc.org/

MEET EVENT LEADER: Lynda Goldschein, cell day of hike only[masked]-5012.
Meet at Seeley's Pond Parking lot. Hike 4.5 miles, 2.5 hours. A little steep at the beginning and then fairly level for the rest of the hike. Bring water and a snack. Hiking boots required. Snow shoes or traction devices may be needed for trails if there is snow. Please watch this site on the morning of March 30 for any last minute changes/cancellations.

DIRECTIONS: 
GPS address is 56 Valley Road, Berkeley Hts, NJ
Coordinates: N40° 40.17', W74° 24.19'
See the GPS map for this event to determine the best route, depending on which direction you are approaching from. 
  From I-78 going EB, take exit 43.  Make a left onto Valley Road, then a right into parking lot.

From I-78 going WB, take exit 43 onto Diamond Hill Rd NB.  Go .4 miles and turn left onto Mountain Ave.  Go .2 miles and turn right onto Martins Lane, then turn right onto Union Ave, which turns into Diamond Hill Rd. SB.  In approx 1 mile, turn left onto Valley Road, then turn right into parking lot.

From Rt 22 EB take the Park Ave exit in Scotch Plains and follow signs towards I-78.  After crossing over Rt 22, stay straight on New Providence Rd (do not turn left to go to I-78).  Road changes names to Diamond Hill Rd.  About a mile after leaving 22, turn right at Valley Rd., then turn right into parking lot.

From Rt 22 WB

 – After passing Bowcraft Amusement Park in Scotch Plains, turn right onto Union Ave. (just past McDonald’s).  At the T, turn right onto New Providence Rd, which turns into Diamond Hill Rd.  Turn right at the next traffic light onto Valley Rd, then turn right into parking lot.

For those familiar with the TRAILSIDE CENTER parking area: 
Exit Trailside parking lot and go straight across the road onto Coles Ave. which becomes Skytop Dr. (a winding, wooded road). Drive 2.7 miles, just over a small bridge. results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.description:
Have You Found Your Tribe? 

Would you like to meet with like-minded parents and fellow community members, build social and health connections, establish a supportive Community & Discussion Group, nourish and expand your parenting options, and continue your personal growth to enable you to be the best parent you can be? 


Join us for our FREE PATHWAYS CONNECT MEETINGS! Pathways Connect is a nonprofit, educational, wellness program and is free to parents. Pathways mission is to support you and your family through your health journey. Pathways Connect offers us a community to support each other in our conscious choices for family wellness. Using Pathways magazine as a springboard for topics, we will discuss each new quarterly issue’s articles at our Gathering Groups. 

Our Pathways Connect Gathering Groups Offer: 

• Trustworthy and current information from the conscious choice magazine, Pathways to Family Wellness. 

• Outstanding resources provided through Pathways Connect’s quarterly Dialogue and Resource Guide.


• Continuous support for your individual family wellness choices 

• A community of like-minded parents to connect with.

Our  Gathering will be lead by Dr. Erin O’Daniel who is a local chiropractor at Flower of Life Chiropractic. All attendees will receive a complimentary issue of Pathways. We will also distribute an electronic copy of the article. Because our groups are catering to parents, children are welcome.

Whether you have had a chance to read the articles, or not, ALL are welcome to attend our gatherings. We hope to see you then and encourage you to bring a friend or two.

*Topics are directed by the group but may include: Birth and pregnancy, Compassionate parenting, The science of wellness, nutrition - including gluten-free, whole foods and seasonal recipes, Child development & educational reform, Coping with children's allergies and food sensitivities, Helping your child deal with change, The vaccination controversy, Consciousness and the MotherBaby bond, Psychiatric drugs and your children, Tending the garden of your child's mind, Creating healthy babies, Breastfeeding and your kids, and Midwifery and hospital births.

More info on Pathways Family Wellness Magazine

results.description:
Do you often find yourself having little control over your emotions?

Do you experience anxiety and want to overcome it?

Do you act impulsively and later regret your actions?

If you answered "yes" to any of the questions above, this meditation is for YOU!

"Thoughts," according Buddhist monk Matthieu Ricard, "can be our best friends and our worst enemies."

Osho Says, "the mind can be a beautiful servant, or a dangerous master." 

In this guided meditation call, we will learn how to observe our own thoughts and cultivate the space between our thoughts. This space is often referred to as nirvana, ecstasy, and enlightenment.  When we enter this space we have total control over our emotions and actions. 


Until what is on the inside - that is, your mind - is corrected, the external world, that is, how you perceive and experience the world around you will be a mere reflection of it.

We will learn an ancient 5,000 year old Vedic technique taught by Indian enlightened master Paramahamsa Nithyananda, called "unclutching." In this technique we learn how to master our thoughts, and as a result control our emotions. 

Join me on this enlightening 45 minute experience! 

In love and abundance, 

Ayelet Shimron 

http://ayeletshimron.com/

www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron


[masked]-GOAL 

Testimonials from previous Life Transformers:

"Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. It's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I haven't come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

The meditation helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC

How You Can Discover, Develop, and Deliver Winning Ideas - Dr. Liz Alexander 

Not all “ideas” are created equal. How do some people manage to easily find “winning” ideas? Why is it important to know what category your ideas fall into, so you can take the correct action to develop them? How can you ensure your idea will be compelling enough to others? 

Why attend this webinar:

1. What best-selling authors can teach you about coming up with relevant, compelling, and intriguing ideas.

2. How to use the Ideas Matrix to establish the right category (and action) for your ideas

3. Why do some ideas take hold and others don’t? Using a well-researched, five-factor model to ensure you can communicate the advantages of your idea to your target audience

results.description:
Another perfect forecast for Wed. is expected so come enjoy this new, easy walk in the woods at the Emerson Woods Preserve. The preserve borders and offers beautiful views of the Oradell Reservoir, has lush wetlands and vernal ponds with tree lined paths.  The short, exotic bamboo like(in appearance) plant called "horsetails" is prevalent and was used by the early settlers for scrubbing pots due to its rough surface. 

The walk will  be about 1 1/2 hours(includes break) at a steady pace covering approx. 3-4 miles on wide woods trails, primarily flat with some wet, possibly muddy areas(usually avoidable). 

WATER is MANDATORY, weather resistant hiking shoes or boots are recommended as are bugspray, sun protection, plus binoculars for birding and cameras of course.

MEET IN PARKING LOT IN FRONT OF SHOP RITE AT THE CORNER OF MAIN ST. AND OLD HOOK RD for 5 minute walk to park. 

FOR DIRECTIONS TO SHOP RITE GO TO: http://www.yelp.com/map/shoprite-emerson and enter your address

Optional dinner at local venue The Recovery Room located at  65 Old Hook Rd. (left on Old Hook Rd. at intersections w/ Main about 1 1/2 miles down the road on the left after the cemetery)

photos by yours truly   (Horsetails /water loving equisetum)
results.how_to_find_us: Shop Rite  parking lot at corner of Main and Old Hook Rd. (front lot facing Main)
results.name: Midweek Walk in the woods  at The Emerson Woods Preserve

results.description:
Since Wendesdays in the Spring and Summer tend to be the most popular times. I am going to put in a few new  ground rules, so by RSVP-ing "yes" you hereby state you have read the following stipulations and will abide by them. We are setting the RSVP limit to 26 but do not be disheartened to join the "wait-list".  Those who RSVP"yes" are given a definite spot in the game if they arrive before or EXACTLY at 5:30. If you have been "wait-listed" and arrive before or at 5:30 and slots are open, you are given a spot. For those who do not RSVP and just show up must wait until 5:30pm and depending upon the order you showed up in and if the conditions mentioned above are not met, you will be allowed to play to make it so the teams are 13 each. If you have RSVP-ed and do not show up by the time we kick off and teams are full, you will be put aside.  for those who show up late, I will set some cones aside so you can play a smaller game against anyone else who shows up late. If you don't show up at all and RSVP-ed "yes", you will be warned 3 times and after that every time I see your name on RSVP you will be put as a "no". I know this is an issue for some of you but please understand in all fairness we don't want a game of 14 v 14, the field does not have enough space.

 If you have any gripes about this please message me and we can talk but in all likely-hood I will not make an exception.

results.description:
￼“Collective Song Club”   Meets every other Wednesday – 5:30-8:30PM

The "Collective Song Club” will begin on October 14th and follow every other Wednesday evening (skipping the night before Thanksgiving).

Location: Planet Studio NYC (www.planetstudionyc.com) 

244 West 54th Street between Broadway and 8th Avenue in Suite 800B on the 8th floor. It will begin at 5:30PM so those heading home from work can stop in without it getting too late. Each session will end promptly at 8:30pm when the studio will go back into record mode for the evening schedule. Drop in at anytime up until 7:30pm during each session. You can’t even really be late! Leave when you like!


The goal of the Collective Song Club is to create a nurturing space for songwriters, artists and producers to present their works in progress, completed songs and productions as well as ask questions about the music business. Vetting songs about to be recorded will give you one more moment of clarity and reflection before you spend energy and dollars on your recording. Song tempos and keys can be discussed as well as best possible producers and vocalists for your project. The studio will have guitars and a keyboard available so no need to feel you have to bring your own. The studio can playback a CD, your iPhone or Android, MP3 player, or connect via the internet to your website or Dropbox. Bring a few lyric sheets of the song you would like to share. The entire evening is about forming a creative community that enhances your art and helps you grow as a songwriter.


There will be no advance payment or sign-up necessary. Each session will cost $20 per person payable at the door as we begin. The studio has a “Square” reader so you can put it on your debit / credit card for $22 with the additional sum to cover the handling charge. Come one week or skip a session - feeling inspired - come on down - feeling tired or have a change of plans - there’s no need to feel like you have to be there. Sessions might be crowded - some might be just a few people - or you!


There are no requirements other than to become a full member of the Collective. The annual membership fee until the end of 2015 is only $35. This membership entitles you to participate in all the Collective workshops as well as perform a song (or have your song performed) in our quarterly Member Benefit Showcases held at the Bitter End. It's easy to become a member - go to www.newyorksongwriterscollective.com and look for "Sign Up/Sign In" in he top right corner of the webpage!


The CSC is an experiment that will hopefully find a place and grow with the necessary changes and additions as it is established. Could it happen every week save for special days and holidays? Could special guests from the industry drop in that would be announced shortly before a session on the Collective website? We shall see!
￼￼
results.name: The "Collective Song Club" presented by the New York Songwriters Collective

results.description:
Hey boys & girls. We've just been invited to attend a special pre-release screaming of the upcoming film, 'Hardcore Henry'. And guess what. We don't have to wait on line for this one. Our passes guarantee us seats. You must be at the theatre and find me No Later Than 5:40pm, as we're all going in together at 5:45pm for the 6:00pm show. If you're late then just go down the street to see a different flick at Show World Center...


HERE'S SOME INFO ABOUT THE FILM:


http://stxmovies.com/HardCoreHenry

Strap in.  “Hardcore Henry” is one of the most unflinchingly original wild-rides to hit the big screen in a long time: You experience the entire film through the main character Henry.  When the film begins, you remember nothing.  Mainly because you’ve just been brought back from the dead by your wife (Haley Bennett).  She tells you that your name is Henry.  Five minutes later, you are being shot at, your wife has been kidnapped, and you should probably go get her back. 


Who’s got her?  His name’s Akan (Danila Kozlovsky); he’s a powerful warlord with an army of mercenaries, and a plan for world domination.  You’re also in an unfamiliar city of Moscow, and everyone wants you dead.  Everyone except for a mysterious British fellow called Jimmy (Sharlto Copley.)  He may be on your side, but you aren’t sure.  If you can survive the insanity, and solve the mystery, you might just discover your purpose and the truth behind your identity.  Good luck, Henry.  You’re likely going to need it…

https://youtu.be/4JVgQzBG5Ho
results.name: Free Pre-release Screaming of HARDCORE HENRY!

results.description:
Registration via this link is mandatory: http://go.bloomberg.com/promo/invite/code-documentary/

Bloomberg's Women in Technology is pleased to invite you and your peers in the New York technology community to a special screening and conversation about the film, Code, an Official Selection of the Tribeca Film Festival.

By 2020, there will be one million unfilled software engineering jobs in the USA. Through compelling interviews, artistic animation and clever flashpoint in popular culture, CODE documentary examines the reasons why more girls and people of color are not seeking opportunities in computer science and explores how cultural mindsets stereotypes, educational hurdles and sexism all play roles in this national crisis.

Kindly note: Due to limited space and security, RSVP on meetup is not enough - MUST register here<a href="http://go.bloomberg.com/promo/invite/code-documentary/"></a>. NO walk-ins. Best suited for women in IT, especially within Finance, Tech, Telecom industries.


AGENDA

5:30 - 6:00 PM: Registration

6:00 - 7:50 PM: Opening Remarks & Movie Screening

7:50 PM: Closing Remarks

8:00 - 8:30 PM: Networking Reception

-----------------------------------------------------------


Hi Everyone,

Welcome to our FinTech Open Mic Night series in New York. Please join us for our monthly mixture of presentations, skype-ins, fireside chats and shout-outs plus plenty of networking.

This monthly session is designed to provide an opportunity to catch up with your peers, to see what's going on in the New York and International FinTech scenes and to tell us all about yourself and your own work.

This month's topic is P2P Lending, a relatively mature area of FinTech with some companies now a decade old and one that is seriously gaining market share from more conventional sources of capital. Please join us to see a range of companies pitch their platforms followed by a panel session discussion with the audience.


                                                  Agenda

Please be aware that the agenda is updated on a regular basis

6:00pm - Doors open

Refreshments and networking opportunities

7:00pm - Session starts

-> Welcome address 

Ashish Singal, NewFinance New York Chapter Organiser


-> Sponsor messages

</a><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/hemantmadaan">Hemant Madaan, CEO & MD, OTS Solutions


Melyssa Brown, Marketing + Community Events Manager at Rise New York 

-> Presentations

Amit Sinha, Co-Founder and CFO, Climb Credit, financing education at over 60 campuses across the country

Bill Liatsis, CEO at CreditIQ, Optimize your borrowing in a whole new way. Get instant loan offers for your auto, home, student, and personal needs


Radhika Duggal, Director, Brand Marketing at CommonBond, shaking up the student loan market, student loan refinancing and consolidation


-> Panel Session

An open discussion with both speakers and delegates exploring the presentations so far and the future of P2P Lending 


In addition to our speakers, we'll be joined by:

Yvan De Munck, Head of Business Development at Raiseworks, LLC, a GLI Finance (GLIF LN) marketplace lending company

8:00pm - Closing

Shout-outs, communications, feedback and thanks

Further networking opportunities

9:00pm - Session ends

For those of you who would like to continue networking we'll retire to a local bar.

Cheers

Eddie


-------------------------------------------------------------

Thank you to our Partners:


OTS Solutions is an Agile Software Development & Technology Product Engineering Company focused on startups and technology entrepreneurs.  With experience of over 13 years, OTS has helped various budding & matured technology businesses in Finance to gain advantage by reducing their burn rates and releasing early to market. Feel free to ask us for help if you struggling with any technology decisions. Contact: Hemant Madaan

Rise New York is a global community of startups and corporates creating the future of commerce and fintech by helping startups and entrepreneurs connect, co-create, and scale innovation. In partnership with Barclays, we listen, nurture and oxygenate through our international network of Rise hubs. Rise New York also houses a world-class event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars.

Join us in our monthly professional business networking event. Healthcare related students and professionals are all welcome!

Mission:


The Healthcare Social Network is a group of like-minded professionals that promotes entrepreneurship and the exchange of creative ideas to improve and promote advancements in the healthcare community.

Our environment:
The HCSN currently hosts networking events on a monthly basis, predominantly in Manhattan during happy hour. An environment consisting of - and shaped by - welcoming and friendly professionals, our aim is to attract those in healthcare across the entire spectrum. In any one of our events, you’ll find professionals working in direct care, in healthcare business development, and even medical students! Our hope is that the casual atmosphere of our events engender any number of takeaways, from a career connection, to advice and guidance, to simply having an opportunity to debrief after work by sharing stories.

Attire: business casual, however scrubs are also allowed

Remember to bring your business cards with you :)

Special thanks to MedTriarch Group's event team for organizing this event!

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
>>>>  PURCHASE TICKETS HERE  <<<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here. 

OP LOUNGE, THE ATTITUDE-FREE NETWORKING SERIES, REVISITS A CLASSIC WATERING HOLE.

On Wednesday, March 30, ascend the stairs to the upper lounge at Therapy, the Hell’s Kitchen classic that is housed in a former carriage house (“Solid and cozy; short on ostentation” — The New York Times).

It’s no secret that today’s economic climate makes it vital to stay connected to others both socially and professionally. That's why Out Professionals … OP.LYNX, our dynamic women’s network … and dozens of our own, up-and-coming LGBT professionals are all coming together tonight. Grab your business cards and enjoy an evening-long Happy Hour: 2-4-1 wines, draft beers and well drinks — and $2 off everything else.

WHAT'S UP 

Out Professionals networking and socializing from 6 p.m. Two-for-one wines, draft beers and well drinks — and $2 off everything else — until 9 p.m.

WHERE

The upstairs lounge at Therapy, 348 West 52nd Street (Eighth-Ninth Avenues). Subway: The No. 1 or the C/E to 50th Street; N/Q/R to 49th Street; B/D/F/M to 47th-50th Streets.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $10. Pre-registered, dues-paying OP Member, free. OP dues-payer at the door, $5. Advance registration closes at noon on March 30. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER

Enjoy a 12-month individual OP membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission to tonight’s event for just $65. And remember, this buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.

results.name: Zumba with Miriam

results.description:
What do I love more than hiking?  FOOD!

Let's hike up to Anthony's Nose after work, share some great food, drinks, laughs and watch the sun go down.  Please bring something yummy to share.  It might be a good idea to bring extra layers because it will be colder once we lose the sun and it tends to be windier at the top (duh).

Feel free to bring whatever snack or drinks you like.  I will supply paper plates, forks, plastic cups AND garbage bags. 

PLEASE CLEAN UP AFTER YOURSELF. THIS IS ONE OF OUR FAVORITE PLAYGROUNDS AND WE WANT TO LEAVE IT CLEAN :)

We will be hiking down in the dark....come prepared please. 

_____________

We will meet just NORTH of the Bear Mountain Bridge.

Distance: about 2-3 miles

Hike time: 1.5 - 2 hours

This hike offers outstanding views up and down the Hudson River and the Bear Mountain Bridge.


Getting There

From NYC take the palisades interstate parkway north for approximately 40 miles until its end at the Bear Mountain Bridge. Take a left at the end of the bridge. Approximately 0.1 miles down the road on the Southbound side is a paved shoulder where we will park. There is a small AT blaze on one of the trees that identifies the trail head.

From I-84, take exit 11 to 9D south. Follow 9D through Beacon and Cold Spring until you reach the Bear Mountain Bridge. Parking is available on small turnoffs on 9D .1 miles before you reach the bridge.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: HIke, Sunset and Buffet on the Mountain *Anthony's Nose*
Improve your public speaking today!
6 spots left - Wednesday soccer @ 6PM

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if more than 3 people come to the class and $15/person if 1 to 3 people come to the class.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation Advanced. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

Join us for our weekly hacknight for Django developers + newcomers to work on their projects and/or connect with other developers. For best results, bring your laptop.

About our host Capital One Labs

At Capital One Labs, we're all about making products that have a big impact. That's why we get out of bed in the morning. When our team isn't venturing to build the next generation of financial products, we're partnering with other Capital One teams to tackle their biggest challenges. But no matter the challenge, we're working to bring humanity and simplicity back to banking.

As part of the GenderCrossing Dinner, we will hear from Dr. Katherine Rachlin, a clinical psychologist, gender specialist, and sex therapist in private practice in New York City.  Gain insight on the CD and transgender experience from someone who has the professional training and experience to give us informed insight.  Participant Q/A will be incorporated.  


And as always, socialize with other transgender/CD's at our wonderful facilities where you can relax in a safe, supportive, non-judgemental group environment.  This particular event is not open to men, only CD's and transgender women.

Bring your clothes and make-up and we will provide a dressing room and well lit make-up station. Doors open at 6pm for changing and socializing. Dinner at 7:30.
Dinner cost $20, first-time participants $10.
Questions, call[masked] or email Allison:  [masked]

Join us again for food, drinks and Go at Pie By the Pound (like them at https://www.facebook.com/piebythepound) near Union Square. Every Wednesday!

This event is free, as usual, thanks to the management of Pie generously hosting us. The pizza's good and the beer is cheap, so come hungry (and thirsty!) and order some food and drinks to thank Pie for hosting us. It's win-win.


Please bring a board if possible!
results.name: Pizza and Go at Pie By the Pound

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

group.name: Victory Pints: Board Games and Beer

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Cubicon Single

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance

• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.
results.how_to_find_us: hi, just ask at the front desk for location of rock & ice meetup group when checking in :)
results.name: Midweek Climbing at Brooklyn Boulders (Group Discount)

results.description:
The Meetup will take place at the Trip Advisor offices. For security only people who have RSVPed will be admitted, so please RSVP, and please make sure that your full names are given, so that you don't have any trouble getting through security on the day.

The event will kick off at 6pm. There'll be food and drink. The talks will kick off at 6.30pm.

We plan to have three talks, 20 minutes each, two from Snowplow users and one from one of the Snowplow team. We look forward to talks from:

* Ben Hoyt, from Oyster.com. Ben will give a bit of background on engineering at Oyster.com, talk about how they got into Snowplow, what they've done in terms of configuration and setup (especially around schemas) and how the data is used for analytics and reporting. 

* Yali Sassoon, cofounder at Snowplow, will give an overview of Snowplow, before discussing some of the analytics trends we see in the Snowplow userbase, namely:

   1. Building single customer views

   2. Building predictive models

   3. Evolving event data pipelines with increasing analytical sophistication and digital product development

* Dani Waxman, from Viewbix, will talk about the journey Viewbix went on prior to and after implementing Snowplow, and how Snowplow is employed to enable their users to drive ROI on spend using the Viewbix platform

* Christophe Bogaert, from Snowplow, will follow up Dani with a talk on modeling event data: taking the particular example of Viewbix, he will walk through the process for defining event and entity schemas, iterating models in Redshift, and explore approaches for handling the different conceptual and technical challenges associated with modeling event data in Redshift.

Snowplow meetups have been great opportunities for companies that are doing sophisticated event analytics to share ideas, approaches and best practices and we look forward to learning what Snowplow users and prospective users are doing in the NYC area!
results.name: Snowplow Meetup New York #1

venue.address_2: Coney Island Ave between Caton & Parkside Avenues

results.description:
Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ipfs-new-york-meetup-tickets-24194265700

YOU MUST REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE TO GET IN!

IPFS -- the InterPlanetary File System -- is making the web faster, safer, decentralized, and more open. It is a new hypermedia distribution protocol, addressed by content and identities. Think Git + BitTorrent + The Web. IPFS is in use by thousands of developers, for all kinds of things from distributing files more efficiently, to making decentralized chat applications, to giving permanent addresses to content, to hosting content for Blockchains. IPFS is one of the hottest and fastest growing Open Source projects! You can learn more about IPFS at https://ipfs.io and https://github.com/ipfs/ipfs

This is the first IPFS NYC Meetup! And most of the core developers are here! Don't miss this opportunity to hang out with us! Join us for an exciting evening of p2p, filesystems, blockchains (bitcoin / ethereum), and apps. Lots of Go and Javascript!

Format: Mingling, 5 short talks, more mingling and maybe hacking.
Drinks: We will serve non-alcoholic drinks (too soon to get caterers or license)
Food: We will have some snacks.

Note that you will have to register again at AWS when getting there to enter. This shouldn't be a hassle, though.
results.name: IPFS invites NYC Mesh to their first official NYC meetup

results.description:
Afraid of brioche?  Learn how simple and satisfying it can be in this basic brioche 2 hour workshop.  


Prerequisite:

You must already know how to cast on, knit, purl, and bind off.  This is not a learn to knit workshop, but rather a specific technique workshop.

Materials:

Two solid (or semi solid) yarns in worsted weight (high contrast would be ideal)


Appropriately sized needles for your yarn.  Circular (length doesn't matter) or double pointed will work for this (straight needle's won't work).  We'll be creating a flat swatch about 20 stitches wide.  Brioche stitch knits up loosely so you may want to choose needles a size down from what you'd normally use on worsted yarn.

If you came to this workshop before, please feel welcome to come again and we can pick up where you left off, improving your understanding of this technique.
results.name: Knitting Workshop - Basic Brioche

results.description:
New to the Real Estate Investing arena?

Just getting your feet wet?

Have you done a deal but it didn’t turn out as you expected?

Over the years we've been assisting individuals become real estate investors, one of the most asked questions has been, "How Do I Get Started in Real Estate Investing?"

Sometimes real estate investing can be scary and it’s easy to get lost in all the books, blogs, seminars, and television gurus. Our main objective is to help you overcome your fears and your countless questions by providing as much education and hands on coaching as possible to help you make the best decisions for your own needs.

Knowledge is YOUR most important currency.

Why do the rich keep getting richer? Wealthy people simply do things differently. Money doesn't make people rich. Knowledge makes people rich.

Financial knowledge – which is never taught in school - can never be taken away from you. It gives you the ability to create cash flow for you and your family no matter what happens to the rest of the economy.

At this event, we will discuss various investment strategies with a focus on ways to create cash flow through real estate as well as other ways to make money in Real Estate. We will also introduce you to the same strategies and ways of thinking about money that successful entrepreneurs have consistently used to create wealth.

Everyone wants to be wealthy, but only a select few will ever TAKE ACTION and get the financial knowledge they need to make their dreams come true. You can be part of the few elite people that choose to Take Action! Your First Step to Financial Freedom is to register for this event.

Choose ACTION. Create SUCCESS.

When will you begin??
results.name: Make Real Estate Investing you main source of income

UPDATE: RSVPs are CLOSED and we are unable to alter the guest list as our host required the names of all attendees in advance. Anyone not currently on the RSVP list will not be permitted to enter by building security. We would love to have you join us at this event in the future!

**NOTE** First and Last Names must be provided for security and a Photo ID is required to enter the event.

In honor of March being Women's History month, we are hosting a trivia night with a Women in Tech History theme!


This is a chance to sharpen your trivia skills while learning about the women who started and prospered in the tech industry along the way. Snacks and drinks will be provided and there are some awesome prizes to be won. We will be dividing everyone in teams of 5-6 people - feel free to come with a team already formed or just arrive solo and meet some new friends. All are welcome!

6:30 - 6:45: Divide into teams

6:45 - 8:00: Trivia Time

8:00 - 8:30: Announce Winners, Networking

A $5 donation to the Girl Develop It scholarship fund is requested for your registration. 



Building Instructions:

Please enter the Empire State Building on the 34th Street side (near the AT&T store) and proceed to the middle of the lobby. Two Linkedin representatives will be stationed next to the Empire State Building's guest check-in desk with your pre-printed elevator pass. Please show your ID to one of the Linkedin employees to obtain your pass and with your pass head up to the 24th floor via elevator bank C.

All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct.
results.name: Women in Tech Trivia Night

results.description:
Following our January meetup where we heard from in-house researchers, this time around we'll hear from consultants and independent researchers to learn how they enable their clients to get the most out of their user research.

Agenda

6:30pm - Meet & Mingle

6:45pm - Breaking the UX Ceiling: Shifting Organizational Perceptions of UX Research


How many of us have been brought in when a product is about to launch and asked to “do some testing?” This ask often translates to merely validating tactical design elements. During the search for these tactical fixes, strategic insights emerge that can inform branding, strategy, and market fit that were never considered prior. This talk will focus on how to shift the perceived value and timing of UX research.


Pete Wasserman
Director, Research & Consulting at Sachs Insights

7:00pm - Houston, we have a problem. Conversions are dropping!

As Sr. UX Researcher at Usablenet, a mobile technology and strategy company, I am called upon to solve a wide variety of usability issues for clients. In the end, my goal is to optimize the end-user’s experience.


Marianne van Ooij
Sr. UX Researcher at Usablenet

7:15pm - Yes, we have Personas...now what?

Knowing your customers is a necessity in the B2B space. These short case studies illustrate how personas can promote innovation, accelerate time to market and translate into measurable profitability.


Alfred Kahn
UX Leader & Strategist

7:30pm - Remembering Humans

Keeping empathy in user research when running lean.


Missy Kelley
Lead User Experience Designer at Ammunition


7:45pm - Q&A

8:00pm - Networking

About Lifion


Lifion, by ADP, invites you to visit our new home for big ideas, ambitious folks, and those who are truly committed to delivering finely made products at scale. Join us after-hours for provocative talks, engaging discussions and some great opportunities to connect with serious thinkers and doers. Visit us at www.lifion.com for a calendar of upcoming events and current job opportunities. We look forward to meeting you soon!
results.name: Product Research as a Service: Helping Clients Use Research Effectively.

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 30 singles will be attending!

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/jolUiP

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/44RGHb

What's included:

• Free Bowling Games & Shoe Rental  

• Ice Breakers & Scorecard Matching

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Drink Specials 

• Prizes for winning team

*Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/jolUiP

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/44RGHb

*Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door

Can I still attend even If I don't want to bowl? Yes, you can still be a member of the team and mingle. Food & Drink will also be available for purchase.

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% attend on their own.

Is this age/ethnic specific? This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+.

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase tickets below -

MEN Prepay Here - https://goo.gl/jolUiP

WOMEN Prepay Here - https://goo.gl/44RGHb
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 30 singles will be attending!

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/jolUiP

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/44RGHb

• Free Bowling Games & Shoe Rental  

• Ice Breakers & Scorecard Matching

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Drink Specials 

• Prizes for winning team

results.description:
NO IRISH NEED APPLY! Dressed in black hoods, members of the secret American Protective Association (APA) practiced bizarre rituals to promote hatred and bigotry toward Irish Catholics. Although Irish Americans had dug the canals and laid the rails for the nation’s infrastructure, they still labored in sweat shops at the whim of factory owners. Winning political power was their sole path to counter ruling class oppression, but Irish political success fanned resentments that could only end in violence, as it did in Troy, New York in March of 1894.
State Democrat Boss Ed Murphy, a Troy brewer, US Senator and Tammany loyalist, maintained total power by voter fraud and violence until one of his henchmen fatally shot Protestant poll-watcher Robert Ross. APA Wizard Frank Black saw how he could turn public outrage for Ross’s murder to his own political advantage using an Irish scapegoat. With no knowledge of the facts, Black declared Bartholomew “Bat” Shea the culprit, and publicly vowed to see Shea executed and Murphy dethroned. Black ran Shea’s criminal prosecution behind the scenes, personally conducting witness interviews, burying inconsistent testimony and illegally advising the grand jury. Bat Shea was convicted of first degree murder and sent to the electric chair.
Three days before Shea’s execution, another man confessed. The governor stayed Shea’s execution to see if a new trial was warranted. Knowing that any scrutiny would expose how he railroaded Shea and thereby end his political career, Frank Black manipulated public opinion to prevent a new trial. Bartholomew Shea, a semi-literate saloon thug, met his death with courage, humility and transcendent forgiveness. Five thousand Irish millworkers followed Shea’s hearse in a blinding snowstorm to lay him to rest. The day after Shea’s execution, New York Republicans nominated Frank Black for governor, and that fall he won.
Jack Casey, attorney, songwriter and author, will bring this true American-Irish tragedy to life at the American Irish Historical Society on March 30, 2016, enhancing his talk with dramatic songs he wrote for the stage play. Casey has told the story of Bat Shea in many formats most recently completing its screenplay. www.BatShea.com
The Society will host a short reception with refreshments following the presentation.

Students: Free
General Admission: $10
Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-trial-of-bat-shea-a-jack-casey-lecture-with-music-tickets-20950083263?ref=ebtnebregn
results.name: THE TRIAL OF BAT SHEA: A Lecture with Music - MLC Host: Mila

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING 

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description:
Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required

results.description:
We are thrilled to host a Coder Career Series every other Wednesday at Byte Academy. The events will help attendees brush up on programming on-the-job or land that perfect job. Regulars range from people who recently learned how to code, to developers at the New York area's top technology companies. Cracking the Coding Interview (5th or 6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell will be followed. Although the event will break individuals into groups to discuss the topics of choice, this session’s focus is Chapter 1. Chapters are non-cumulative, and coders of all different skills and languages are welcome.

The series will run every other Wednesday and is a joint event with the Fin-Tech Meetup, http://www.meetup.com/Byte-Academy-Finance-and-Technology-community/.

About Byte Academy: Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)
results.name: Algorithms and Interview Prep at Byte Academy

results.description:
***TO RSVP YOU MUST CLICK HERE ***

Join us for a evening of networking with members of the TiE Community. This networking event is not your typical meet and greet. There will also be a platform with an open mic for participants, entrepreneurs and investors to introduce themselves, talk about their business, or just raise discussion points! (each individual will be given a few minutes at the microphone).

IN ADDITION:  There will be a 10 minute fireside chat with Sachin Shah who is Principal at Ada, an investments, management company providing liquid and low volatility solutions to institutional and private clients globally. Sachin has developed platforms for trading, research and portfolio management, in use at major banks and hedge funds. The fireside chat with Tariq Khan will focus on what makes for a good start-up investment pitch, to bring out some of the do/do nots for budding entrepreneurs!

Wednesday, March 30th
6:30PM 
WeWork Penn Station
TIE NY Members: FREE
Non Members: $10

To become a member of TiE NY Click HERE

ABOUT TiE NEW YORK

TiE is a non-profit, global community welcoming entrepreneurs from all over the world. We believe in the power of ideas to change the face of entrepreneurship and growing business through our five pillars; mentoring, networking, education, incubating and funding. TiE was founded in 1992 by a group of successful entrepreneurs and is currently the world’s largest entrepreneurial organization out there. With programs like TiE Young Entrepreneurs (TYE) and Mentor Match, TiE is reaching out and fostering the next generation of entrepreneurs.

We help entrepreneurs go global. As a TIE member, you are connected with over 11,000 members across 61 chapters. Wherever in the world you are, meet leaders, attend events and participate in unique speaking opportunities. From outsourcing advice to global business development, TIE has you covered.

Being a TIE member is your gateway to global business. Join today.
To learn more, please attend an event, join our mailing list, or become a member!
results.name: TiE New York Networking & Open Mic Night

group.name: TiE New York - Fostering Entrepreneurship Globally

Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

results.description:
The Place: Nobu New York, the flagship restaurant of Chef Nobu Matsuhisa, has been a pioneer for Japanese cuisine since its opening in 1994. Nobu partnered with restaurateur Drew Nieporent, Meir Teper, and Oscar-winning actor Robert De Niro to bring his modern Japanese to Tribeca. Nobu draws upon his classical training at sushi bars in Tokyo and his life abroad in Peru, Argentina, and around the world to create a whole new trend in Japanese cuisine. The resulting dishes, including Yellowtail with Jalapeno, Tiradito Nobu Style, Lobster with Wasabi Pepper Sauce, and Black Cod with Miso, make Nobu the innovator of new style Japanese food. 

http://www.noburestaurants.com/new-york/experience/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

venue.name: American Irish Historical Society

results.description:
NO IRISH NEED APPLY! Dressed in black hoods, members of the secret American Protective Association (APA) practiced bizarre rituals to promote hatred and bigotry toward Irish Catholics. Although Irish Americans had dug the canals and laid the rails for the nation’s infrastructure, they still labored in sweat shops at the whim of factory owners. Winning political power was their sole path to counter ruling class oppression, but Irish political success fanned resentments that could only end in violence, as it did in Troy, New York in March of 1894.
State Democrat Boss Ed Murphy, a Troy brewer, US Senator and Tammany loyalist, maintained total power by voter fraud and violence until one of his henchmen fatally shot Protestant poll-watcher Robert Ross. APA Wizard Frank Black saw how he could turn public outrage for Ross’s murder to his own political advantage using an Irish scapegoat. With no knowledge of the facts, Black declared Bartholomew “Bat” Shea the culprit, and publicly vowed to see Shea executed and Murphy dethroned. Black ran Shea’s criminal prosecution behind the scenes, personally conducting witness interviews, burying inconsistent testimony and illegally advising the grand jury. Bat Shea was convicted of first degree murder and sent to the electric chair.
Three days before Shea’s execution, another man confessed. The governor stayed Shea’s execution to see if a new trial was warranted. Knowing that any scrutiny would expose how he railroaded Shea and thereby end his political career, Frank Black manipulated public opinion to prevent a new trial. Bartholomew Shea, a semi-literate saloon thug, met his death with courage, humility and transcendent forgiveness. Five thousand Irish millworkers followed Shea’s hearse in a blinding snowstorm to lay him to rest. The day after Shea’s execution, New York Republicans nominated Frank Black for governor, and that fall he won.
Jack Casey, attorney, songwriter and author, will bring this true American-Irish tragedy to life at the American Irish Historical Society on March 30, 2016, enhancing his talk with dramatic songs he wrote for the stage play. Casey has told the story of Bat Shea in many formats most recently completing its screenplay. www.BatShea.com
The Society will host a short reception with refreshments following the presentation.

Students: Free
General Admission: $10
Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-trial-of-bat-shea-a-jack-casey-lecture-with-music-tickets-20950083263?ref=ebtnebregn
results.name: THE TRIAL OF BAT SHEA: A Lecture with Music

results.description:
Topic Maps At Work. the Next Generation


Topic maps applications are different from mainstream semantic web applications because they also enable users to define the semantics of their navigation, rather than simply relying on automated algorithms to guess what the content is about. This presentation will describe the lessons learned from years of providing topic map applications, and the principles on which new applications are being designed. It will be illustrated with two case studies: IRS Taxmap and a current project in development for a University library. 

Dr. Michel Biezunski is a consultant/developer working for Infoloom and has been one of the initiators and an editor of the ISO/IEC 13250 Topic Maps standard. He has created the“Data Projection Model”, an approach for auditing information networks. His background is in history and philosophy of science and he is interested in bridging intellectual work with up-to-date technologies. (More at: https://www.infoloom.com/about-us/michel-biezunski-1/) 

Sources: Publications: https://www.infoloom.com/about-us/michel-biezunski-1/publications/XML Topic Maps: Finding Aids for the Web:http://www.coolheads.com/SRNPUBS/ieee-mm-topicmaps-article.pdfData Projection Model:The Data Projection Model (https://www.infoloom.com/media/misc/dataprojection.pdf)IRS Tax Map:http://taxmap.ntis.gov

Your News: Are You Getting What You Need?

With so many ways to get news, have you stopped to figure out if your current mix of sources are timely, accurate, and thorough? Do you rely on curators and aggregators? Do your alerts need refreshing? With a workshop format, we will look at our current methods to see if there are gaps as they may affect the quality of our perspectives. Come praise your most valued sources and find out what others like. No need to wait, though, pick a couple of these to try out before the workshop: Quartz (Daily Brief), Medium (Daily Digest), theSkimm, Vox (Sentences), NextDraft, and Global Voices. Purveyor mode turned on? Start posting now!

Chris Novell has a B.Ed and MBA. She worked as an internal consultant at Chase Manhattan Bank and as an Oppenheimer Research Department assistant. She has also trained in the CERT program (Community Emergency Response Team).

She has developed some deep learning techniques, created some educational tools and likes to enable students to have what she describes as a "peak learning experience." She has observed that young children absorb more sound bites than most adults realize. Interaction Design concepts have inspired her to design interactive and participatory art. While digital solutions can be powerful, Chris notes that mechanical ones can be magical, too. She marvels at the learning opportunities that Meetup groups have created!

This Meetup Mashup includes the following meetup communities: 

Information Architecture: 

http://www.meetup.com/information_architecture/

Semiotics Web: http://www.meetup.com/SemioticsWeb/

Axiologue: http://www.meetup.com/Axiologue/

OWASP Brooklyn: http://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Brooklyn/

results.description:
Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required

Gear up for a night of Linux and Security! You will hear about different parts of security, including:

intro to different parts of security
- web/application
- network
- forensics/analysis


Our presenter is Nicole Becher, a Forensics & Security Engineer with over 10 years experience in infosec, securing bitcoin/virtual currencies, bitcoin regulation and compliance, blockchain technology, penetration testing, forensics & incident response, malware analysis, threat intelligence, application & mobile security, software development. She is an adjunct instructor at New York University, currently teaching Computer Forensics, Securing Web Applications, and Intrusion Detection: Hacking Understood. She researches malware analysis, cryptography, hardware programming, web application security, cyber crime and cyber laws. She's an active OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) member who wrote vulnerable software for the “capture the flag” contest at AppSecUSA 2013. Currently participating in a cyber-policy fellowship with the Madison Policy Forum in New York City.

This meetup is sponsored by Uber NYC.

results.description:
Can food e-commerce startups disrupt the $600B grocery industry? From plant-based meal kits to one-hour grocery delivery apps, a growing crop of companies are turning online to meet consumer demand for food that's more healthy, convenient and personalized.


Come network with the community and meet some of these e-commerce innovators at our March Food+Tech Meetup. You'll get an inside look at their business models, challenges and lessons learned.

We'll have a taco bar from Empellon, make-your-own bowls from Ox Verte, nibbles from Matt's Kimchi and Barnana and beer.


SCHEDULE:

6:30 - 7:15: Networking + Snacks

7:15 - 8:45: Presentations + Q&A

8:45 - 9:30: More Networking


CONFIRMED PRESENTERS:

Andy Levitt - Founder & CEO, The Purple Carrot - Purple Carrot makes it easy to prepare healthy, satisfying and delicious plant-based meals at home. We deliver pre-measured ingredients that are responsibly sourced, often organic, and always non-GMO. With easy-to-follow recipes, you'll enjoy amazing meatless meals while helping to build a better food system. 


Jason Lepes - Head Merchant, <a>FoodKick</a> by Freshdirect - a new mobile-first food business that connects consumers to the freshest, tastiest finds in food, drinks, and lifestyle essentials all delivered within an hour.

Ben McKean - Founder & CEO, Hungryroot - Hungryroot makes fresh, feel good convenience foods. Prior to Hungryroot, Ben was a Vice President and General Manager at Groupon, overseeing their food and beverage business. Ben came to Groupon through the acquisition of Savored, which he founded in 2009. Savored was the nation’s leading provider of yield management technology to the restaurant industry. Prior to Savored, Ben worked in Merrill Lynch’s technology investment banking group. Ben is graduate of Georgetown University and currently lives in New York City.

Rune F. Knudsen - Founder & CEO, TrySome - a free and subscription based online marketplace that allows consumers to try organic, vegan and other responsibly made products in exchange for data and feedback. TrySome creates a new connection between consumers and manufacturers that removes the consumers’ risk of making a “wrong” choice and buying a product (which is oftentimes a more expensive choice) that they are not happy with. 

Nicole Chaszar - Founder & CEO, Splendid Spoon - Splendid Spoon cleanses and meal replacements take the hard work out of eating well. Formulated to provide the right balance of protein, complex carb and fat, our plant-based products keep you feeling fit, full and fabulous.
results.name: The Business of Food E-Commerce

results.description:
How do you know how much your intellectual property is worth? Should you license it or sell? If you are selling it, what is a good deal? 

Being able to value your IP allows you to determine an exit strategy, provides leverage in investor negotiations, during an acquisition or when one of the equity stakeholders leaves.

In this Workshop we will cover:

1. What is IP and how is it accounted for on the Balance Sheet?

2. When is it important to know what your Intangible Assets are worth?

3. Three valuation approaches:

A. The Cost Approach - based on the direct (e.g. equipment) and indirect (e.g. labor) costs incurred in creating an asset 

B. The Market Approach - based on comparables

C. The Income Approach - based on the income an asset is expected to generate

We will discuss circumstances which will warrant using one approach over another, how each approach works and do a case study for each.

Finally, we will cover under which circumstances one can capitalize software development costs as an asset on the balance sheet.

Payment for the Workshop will be required at the point of registration.

The early bird price of $27.50 is available until March 25th. After this the price goes to regular: $32.50.

The workshop is hosted by the NY Startup Law Center - www.nystartuplawcenter.com.
results.name: What is your IP worth? Licensing vs. Selling - Sold Out
