results.description:
** CLICK LINK TO ATTEND: http://bit.ly/1Qu9s5s**  


An important skill for a Product Manager is the ability to parachute into an existing product and land on your feet. In this workshop you will learn how to immerse yourself in your new company and learn as much as you can as quickly as you can. Paul has been in product management for over ten years and has parachuted into several existing products, all in different industries.

Timeline:

6:30 - 6:45 pm - Meet & Greet

6:45 - 7:45 pm - Speaker Discussion

7:45 - 8:30 pm - Networking

* refreshments & snacks will be provided

Takeaways:

• Learn how to identify and differentiate between business & technical stakeholders 


• Understand your products problem domain 

• How to collect good qualitative data 

• Learn how to set expectations with an new team 

• Learn how to become the product diplomat 

Meet the speaker:


Paul Hurwitz is Director of Active Analytics at ActiveHealth Management, a Healthagen Company and subsidiary of Aetna. He is responsible for the strategic roadmap and execution of the Active Analytics product suite, which is focused on providing clinical analytics solutions and reporting to the payer/provider customer base. Paul is an experienced product management professional with over 15 years of experience in technology management and 10 years in product management. Prior to ActiveHealth, he led a cross-functional team at Medidata Solutions working on life sciences software for the design and optimization of clinical trials. Paul is a member of the Boston Product Management Association, Boston CTO Club and co-founder of the Boston Jewish Outdoors Club. 

About our Co-hosts: 

Product School offers product management courses in San Francisco, Silicon Valley and New York.

Grind isn’t an office, it’s the antidote to offices. A members-only shared workspace and coworking community dedicated to taking all of the frustrations of working the old way and pulverizing them to a dust so fine it actually oils the wheels of the machine.
results.name: How to Successfully Parachute into an Existing Product

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Dining

DESCRIPTION:
This MeiJin is on point! Whenever I have visitors in from out of town, this place is on the top of my list to show off the great restaurants in my hood. The food is always flavorful and the portions are monstrous. I always have leftovers which I'm not mad about! Huge fan of the curry soy ramen (chicken broth) and the chili ramen. Both have excellent flavor profiles. Heat but with flavor, so you aren't getting a spice bomb that just knocks out all of your taste buds. The buns are a great way to start. And whatever tempura veggie they have feature, just get it.

They have an awesome sake selection as well. Check it out. They are an amazing addition to the UES restaurant scene.


MENU:
http://naparat.wix.com/meijintemporary#!ramen/cee5

FOOD GALLERY:
• Japanese Style Curry with Fried Chicken and Rice 


• Beef Broth Spicy Chili: Ground beef, bean sprout, arugula, bamboo, naruto, green onion, garlic chips, sesame, chili pepper, chili oil


• Crispy Sesame Chicken Don

• Chicken Broth Soy: Braised pork, bean sprout, arugula, bamboo, naruto, green onion, egg, sesame

• Tuna TarTar

• Yuzu CheeseCake

RESTAURANT GALLERY:
• Dining Room


• The Bar & Kitchen

• Inside Dining Room

RESTAURANT REVIEW:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/mei-jin-ramen-new-york

results.description:
Google Analytics is a MUST HAVE on any website. It’s the single most powerful free tool out there for understanding and improving your website traffic.

Website owners and those who build them for clients can both benefit tremendously from a little GA knowledge.


Do you know what pages your website visitors spend the most time on? Or how many new people visit per month? If not you and your clients are missing a boatload of useful information that could get your website more traffic and more revenue.


***Who Should Attend?


Website Owners:
Don't get caught with your pants down. Know what pages your users are looking at the most, what content sucks, and where they're dropping off before hitting the BUY button.

Website Developers/Maintainers:
Look like a superhero in front of your clients by telling them how THEY can improve their traffic, engagement and sales.


What Will We Cover?

• Installing Google Analytics

• How to find out what pages your users visit

• How to find out when and why people LEAVE your website

• What search keywords people are using to find your site

• Your users' demographics - location, language, mobile devices, etc.


...and more. Come get familiar with one of the most essential tools in the web world, hands down.


------------------------------------------------------------------------
Join the ATTCK.io mailing list for upcoming events, learning materials and exclusive discounts: http://attck.io.
results.name: Knowledge is Power: Intro to Google Analytics

results.description:
Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required

Open Play for Advanced Beginners and Intermediate Players.

Our game starts promptly at 6:30pm.  You are welcome to come slightly earlier to change and warm up.

We can accommodate 2 teams, 8 players per team max (double rotation). Rally scoring. Game to 25. 

IMPORTANT - Skill Level Required for our Open Play

Know how to rotate on the court, serve, pass, set, spike and block. Know how to hold your position on the court during defense and offense.  This is meant for players that have experience playing.

Rules will be enforced to protect all players from safety and fun.

Recreational players and beginners can practice on the side or come watch for FREE. We also run a skills clinic to improve your game. Please ask!

If you will be attending for the first time, please check in with me for a quick 3 min assessment. 

Thanks and hope to see you on the court!

May

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour that includes an ice breaker and prizes, light appetizers, and is topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates."

Now, in addition to making potential dates, you'll also be able to select "Friendship" as a match possibility. Your opportunity for making connections just doubled! This is perfect if you're new in town or looking to meet new single friends as well as possible romantic partners.


The ice breaker will help you meet both men and women so you can make friends AND get dates!


HOW IT WILL WORK:

7-7:45pm - Happy Hour complete with light appetizers, a fun ice breaker, and  prizes awarded to the two people who get the most matches.

7:45pm - You'll be seated for your first speeddating round.

7:45-8:30 - You'll have approximately* 7-10  three to four minute "mini-dates"

8:30 - Turn in your dating cards to the host and mingle. Matches will be emailed to you within 48 hours.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Make Friends, Get Dates Happy Hour -  Ages 27-39 - 2F/2M SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
Welcome in Spring with an Energetic Tune-Up

Wednesday, March 30th @ TRS 7:00pm - 8:30pm

Please follow this link to register and secure your ticket. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/welcome-in-spring-with-an-energetic-tune-up-tickets-19370399386

Re-set your energetic system to allow for greater harmony and balance. This healing will provide a general clearing and re-vitalization of the chakras, energetic bodies and body pathways for general health and well-being. There will also be time spent nurturing and grounding the physical body.

VortexHealing® is an extraordinary healing modality that works through consciousness and matter. It focuses on healing and the acceleration of spiritual awakening.

This event is open to everyone and their guests, feel free to share this invitation. The event is FREE of charge, but registration at Eventbrite.com is required as space is very limited. venue.name: High School on Center Blvd (aka Academy for Careers in Television and Film)

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).
results.how_to_find_us: High School on Center Blvd (aka Academy for Careers in Television and Film)  1-50 51st Ave, Long Island City, NY

group.name: LIC Hoops - Men's Indoor Pickup Basketball in Hunters Point

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour that includes an ice breaker and prizes, light appetizers, and is topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates."

Now, in addition to making potential dates, you'll also be able to select "Friendship" as a match possibility. Your opportunity for making connections just doubled! This is perfect if you're new in town or looking to meet new single friends as well as possible romantic partners.

The ice breaker will help you meet both men and women so you can make friends AND get dates!

HOW IT WILL WORK:

7-7:45pm - Happy Hour complete with light appetizers, a fun ice breaker, and prizes awarded to the two people who get the most matches.

7:45pm - You'll be seated for your first speeddating round.

7:45-8:30 - You'll have approximately* 7-10  three to four minute "mini-dates"

8:30 - Turn in your dating cards to the host and mingle. Matches will be emailed to you within 48 hours.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Make Friends, Get Dates Happy Hour  Ages 27-39 - 2F/1M SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
Hello NYC Kubernauts!


We are happy to announce the March New York City Kubernetes Meetup (#NYCk8s) will be on Wednesday, March 30th at the Harvest offices in the Flatiron. 

We are excited to welcome the author of O'Reilly's Leaning OpenShift, Grant Shipley from Red Hat. He will show all of the work the OpenShift team have been doing on the open source project. This will include a full demo of the project to show how to create, deploy, scale, manage, and monitor pods for both development and production loads. 

Ray Tsang from Google will also be presenting. He'll give us a look beyond container orchestration with Kubernetes, also also take a deep dive into more advanced features like autoscaling. We'll look at: - How to access the Kubernetes API securely - The different Kubernetes resources, such as Pod, Replication Controller, Service, etc. - How to update/manage your entire cluster using the API. We'll demonstrate all of the concepts via a custom autoscaler that scales a stateful application using custom metrics!

Agenda:

6:30 - 7:00 - Social

7:00 - 7:45 - Grant Shipley - Making Kubernetes accessible to the normal developer

7:45 - 8:30 - Ray Tsang - Scaling with Kubernetes, Automatically! Learn Kubernetes API through writing a visualizer to an autoscaler.

8:30 - 9:00 - Social / Wrap-up


Bios

Grant Shipley works at Red Hat focused on cloud technologies. Prior to that, Grant was a Manager of Software Development with responsibilities over the www.redhat.com website and supporting infrastructure. Grant has over 15 years of software development experience focusing on Java and PHP. In his free time, he contributes to several open source projects as well as developing mobile applications. Grant has been using Linux on a daily basis since 1994 and is active in the FOSS community.


Ray Tsang is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform. Ray had extensive hands on cross-industry enterprise systems integration delivery and management experiences during his time at Accenture, managed full stack application development, DevOps, and ITOps. Ray specialized in middleware, big data, and PaaS products during his time at Red Hat while contributing to open source projects, such as Infinispan. Aside from technology, Ray enjoys traveling and adventures.



Location/Instructions:

Our friends at Harvest have offered to provide space for this upcoming event. The address is:

16 W 22nd St 
8th Floor
New York, NY 10010
results.name: OpenShift and Kubernetes

results.description:
THE HIDDEN BOOK IN THE BIBLE. Dr. Richard Elliott Friedman

As all biblical scholars know, the Bible was written by a number of authors over a long period of time and then edited down into the work with which we are all familiar (more or less; mostly less). 

But now the renowned biblical sleuth and scholar, Dr. Richard Elliott Friedman, a professor at the University of California, San Diego, reveals his most startling and revolutionary discovery: buried within the Bible is a continuous narrative, a 3000-year-old epic of love, deception, war, and redemption, written by a single, masterful author but subsequently sliced apart by ancient editors who interlaced it with other stories, laws and poetry.  

Using a creative blend of scholarship and detective work, Dr. Friedman has joined together this story from the dawn of written history into the extraordinary form in which it was originally written, what he calls “the first prose masterpiece”.

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Great Lectures on DVD: "The Hidden Book in the Bible"

results.description:
Juan Verde

Presidente y Fundador de la Advanced Leadership Foundation


 Tendencias Globales para una Economía Competitiva y Sostenible en el Siglo XXI: desafíos y oportunidades.

Juan Verde explicará las razones que llevan a ciertas regiones, empresas o instituciones a liderar la carrera de la sostenibilidad y la innovación, y como consecuencia de ello, también a liderar la economía del siglo XXI.

Como personalidad de referencia en política ambiental y cambio climático, Verde aporta soluciones realistas e innovadoras para dos de los problemas globales más importantes en la actualidad: la recesión económica y la crisis climática, sirviendo de inspiración y liderazgo en muchas áreas de negocio, en las que los avances científicos y tecnológicos y el liderazgo tienen una importancia fundamental.

BIO

Juan Verde es un reconocido asesor económico y político de gobiernos, instituciones y empresas a nivel internacional. Experto en internacionalización de empresas, estrategia y sostenibilidad, es un incansable emprendedor y abanderado de diferentes causas sociales.

Juan Verde ha sido Co-director Internacional de la Campaña para la Reelección del Presidente Barack Obama así como su asesor en temas de economía internacional, sostenibilidad y comunidad hispana. Previamente ocupó el puesto de Subsecretario Adjunto para Europa y Eurasia del Departamento de Comercio del Gobierno de EE.UU. Asimismo, durante la administración del presidente Clinton trabajó como Asesor de Comercio Internacional para ese mismo departamento. Actualmente es un estrecho colaborador de la Campaña de Hillary Clinton a la presidencia de los EEUU.

Gracias a su amplia experiencia como asesor político, Verde ha trabajado en numerosas campañas políicas. En el sector privado, Juan Verde ha sido fundador, accionista mayoritario, ejecutivo o consejero de varias empresas e instituciones.

Como impulsor de iniciativas sociales y persona de referencia en política ambiental, fue fundador y máximo responsable de “The Climate Reality Project Spain”, rama española del Proyecto contra el Cambio Climático de Al Gore, ex vicepresidente de EE.UU. Asimismo, preside la Fundación Advanced Leadership, una institución sin ánimo de lucro que fomenta y desarrolla habilidades de liderazgo en los futuros líderes empresariales, políticos y sociales.

Esta actividad está patrocinada por la Fundación Ramón Areces y está organizada en colaboración con el Instituto Cervantes de NY.


Tras la conferencia habrá una recepción para todos los asistentes.


Este evento es gratuito pero tiene aforo limitado. Por favor, rellena el siguiente RSVP
results.name: Juan Verde - Founder of the Advanced Leadership Foundation

This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play!

• Have an amazing time!

Every Sunday 3-5pm starting January 10th til April 17th, a week before the performance, 15 practice sessions.

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, March 30th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The April session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (March 30th - April 20th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (March 30th - April 20th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (March 29th - April 19th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY 5 BUCKS!


Welcome To The Writer’s Room


More than just a writing class, our TV Drama workshop gives you the experience of a real writer’s room on a 1 hour TV Drama series, with a teacher with over 15 years of television experience acting as showrunner, and a class of 12 talented student staff writers.

You’ll not only complete an hour-long pilot or spec script for a TV Drama series of your choice, you’ll also collaborate on the development of your fellow students scripts for a different show each week..

What You’ll Learn

You’ll learn the elements of a successful TV Drama series, and how to write a series pilot or series spec script that shows off your talent as a writer, but also your ability to demonstrate your professionalism to every network, studio, and series producer who reads it.

By the time you’re done, you’ll not only have real world experience of working in a TV writer’s room, you’ll also a community of writers you can depend on, and a draft of a professional grade spec script or pilot episode for your own Television Series.

For more info or to set up a plan, give us a call at[masked]-3594.


---

NORMAL COST: $899

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this  10-week workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class Size is Strictly Limited To 12 Students To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. 

You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if more than 3 people come to the class and $15/person if 1 to 3 people come to the class.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation Intermediate. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

results.description:
7:00- Pre-Intermediate Level

Intermediate WCS is a continuation for students who have completed the Beginner Level or possess a good understanding of the basic patterns as well as,  the principles of timing and partnering. Emphasis will be on the continuing development of partnering skills, lead and follow, dance floor etiquette, a good understanding of timing, and the ability to execute simple sequences. New steps and turn patterns will be introduced and linked together to develop new combinations.


8:00- Beginner Level

Beginner WCS Level is an introductory course, which gives a foundation of movement for students who have had little or no dance experience. Emphasis will be on the development of partnering skills, lead and follow, the basic principles of timing, as well as basic foot work and basic patterns.

We suggest between 2 and 4 months in Beginner Level  before you move on to the next Level.

9:15- WCS Party

Please note: for the time being, native speakers of English should not attend the English table in order for participants to feel safe enough to practice English free from intimidation. Thank you for your cooperation.

We are restructuring things a bit. The Japanese table is on hiatus until a teacher is found. The English table that used to be held on Saturday will join the Korean and Chinese tables on Wednesday Evening.

It will be a casual time to practice English conversation over coffee. Feel to bring coffee or buy at Dunkin Donuts or Barnes and Nobles café.

If you have homework or writings that need to be proofread, feel to bring them too.

A little about myself: I am Korean American. English is my first language. I used to teach English for the Language Institute of Yonsei University. I also managed 7 ESL schools in Pennsylvania. I understand the struggle to master a foreign langue in America as my parents are immigrants. I look forward to meeting you.

results.description:
Celebrate the 30th Anniversary of David Lynch's Classic "Blue Velvet"  and then grab a drink, mingle and talk about the film with like-minded people at "Houston Hall."

 **IMPORTANT**

1. Film Forum is a small art-house theater. That means that seating is limited. 
It is recommended you buy your tickets in advance to guarantee your seat: http://filmforum.org/film/david-lynchs-blue-velvet-film

If you do decide to buy your ticket at the box office please be advised they take cash only.


2. Meeting spot: Film Forum at 7pm.
Grab your tickets at the box office and line up for the film with us. We'll be wearing red and white name stickers.


3. You might need your PHOTO ID to enter "Houston Hall."
Please remember to bring it. 

Blue Velvet is a 1986 American neo-noir mystery film, written and directed by David Lynch. Blending psychological horror[3][4] with film noir, the film stars Kyle MacLachlan, Isabella Rossellini, Dennis Hopper and Laura Dern. The title is taken from Bobby Vinton's 1963 song of the same name. Although initially receiving a divided critical response, the film is now widely acclaimed as one of the greatest films of the 1980s, and earned Lynch his second Academy Award nomination for Best Director. As an example of a director casting against the norm, Blue Velvet is also noted for re-launching Hopper's career and for providing Rossellini with a dramatic outlet beyond the work as a fashion model and a cosmetics spokeswoman, for which she had until then been known.

results.description:
THE HIDDEN BOOK IN THE BIBLE. Dr. Richard Elliott Friedman

As all biblical scholars know, the Bible was written by a number of authors over a long period of time and then edited down into the work with which we are all familiar (more or less; mostly less). 

But now the renowned biblical sleuth and scholar, Dr. Richard Elliott Friedman, a professor at the University of California, San Diego, reveals his most startling and revolutionary discovery: buried within the Bible is a continuous narrative, a 3000-year-old epic of love, deception, war, and redemption, written by a single, masterful author but subsequently sliced apart by ancient editors who interlaced it with other stories, laws and poetry.  

Using a creative blend of scholarship and detective work, Dr. Friedman has joined together this story from the dawn of written history into the extraordinary form in which it was originally written, what he calls “the first prose masterpiece”.

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Great Lectures on DVD: "The Hidden Book in the Bible"

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Here is the magical legend of King Arthur, vividly retold through the eyes and lives of the women who wielded power from behind the throne. 

// Book 
Mists of Avalon, Marion Zimmer Bradley

Mists of Avalon is broken out into 4 "books."
For Part 1 we will read Book 1: Mistress of Magic - Book 2: The High Queen 


There is the darkly bewitching Morgaine, half sister to Arthur and a high priestess in the enchanted land of Avalon, where women rule as the creators of life and keepers of knowledge. For Morgaine, there is but one quest: to wrest Britain away from Christianity.
The fair and lovely Queen Gwynhefar is torn between her duty to her king and the new God, and her passion for the dashing Lancelot.
Both women struggle and suffer, and both--in their own extraordinary ways--triumph.  

// Location
Location will be announced soon. 

// Dues 

This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway!

// Next Month
Be sure to join us for Part 2 next month HERE where we'll finish reading Mists of Avalon with Book 3: The King Stag - Book 4: The Prisoner in the Oak.

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.

results.description:
***please note this event is cross-posted on other meet ups &  eventbrite, so attendance is higher than indicated


Join us at the table for part one of an intimate yet challenging 3-part multi-disciplinary exchange of ideas that gives everyone the opportunity to be heard and aims to change how we as a society think about, learn about, and talk about art, science and technology.

March 30th, 7pm-9pm

Pratt Institute

Center for Career & Professional Development

200 Willoughby Ave, East Hall 1, across from the Engine Room

free, space is limited,RSVP

with Special Guests:
* Myles Jackson, NYU Gallatin; Professor, History of Science, Division of Bioethics; Director Science & Society

*Jeremy Blatter, NYU Steinhardt; Professor, Media, Culture, Communication; History of Science


Science (as) Culture: a three part ‘dinner’ conversation

Scientists make discoveries, engineers design new technologies, artists create multi-media installations contemplating how the world works, corporations develop and distribute new products, policymakers, researchers, creatives, and grassroots movements alike attempt to create positive impacts, while some people instead either choose to remain a passive observer or feel their voice goes unheard.

Ideally, all of these actors could work together at all stages of scientific and technological development to ensure the best outcomes for society as a whole. However, integrating these often disparate and sometimes competing fields—labs, creative spaces, corporations, universities, funding organizations, movements, governing bodies, and communities—is challenging.

Ligo Project is working to dissolve those boundaries and to tackle this challenge with creativity.

Join us at the table for an intimate yet challenging 3-part multi-disciplinary discussion that gives everyone the opportunity to be heard and aims to change how we as a society think about, learn about, and talk about art, science and technology.

Be part of the conversation by taking a seat at the table.

Part 1 – Integration of Science & Society: the current view?March 30th, Pratt Institute

Part 2 – Fostering Creativity & Social Responsiveness to Science and within Science, April 26th, Pratt Institute 

Part 3 – Science as Culture: the 1000-year view & how to get there? May 18th, Pratt Institute

How it works:

Science (as) Culture will use a format inspired by Lois Weaver’s conversation as performance project ‘The Long Table’, which is informal, participatory & nonhierarchical. Special guests are invited to “seed” the conversation but the “audience” is invited to take a seat at the table and join in. At all points in this discussion, it will be important not to take “progress” as self evident, and to ask why a particular idea or research practice makes sense. The rules of engagement will be such that free thought and open exchange are highly encouraged at all times – everyone’s voice is heard.

Event Schedule:
Doors: 30 min prior
Discussion: 90 min
Mingling afterwards at a nearby pub

www.ligoproject.org
[masked]
results.name: Reminder Science(as)Culture: Integration of Science & Society: the current view?

results.description:
We’ve all made mistakes, and we’ve all had others hurt and wound us — sometimes in ways that scar us emotionally. Inevitably, these hurts hold us back from all God wants to do in and through our lives. In this class, we’ll have a fantastic time networking and having fun, but we'll also take the time to work through hurts, habits, and hang-ups by letting Jesus heal and transform the heart, mind, and emotions.  We'll all learn biblical strategies for working with God to deal with and heal those emotional wounds that negatively affect us.

In a safe and supportive environment, we’ll address the following issues:

• emotional wounds from past relationships

• sexual trauma

• wounds from fatherlessness

• family wounds

• rejection wounds

• addictions (drugs, alcohol, gambling, etc.)

• pornography/sex addiction

• emotional ties to past boyfriends/girlfriends

• divorce

• depression

• suicidal thoughts

• anger problems

• anxiety issues

• spending problems

• general unhealthy thinking patterns

• people pleasing

• codependency

• control & manipulation

• and much more!

This will be an uplifting class, and no matter what you've gone through, God can and will help you work through it.

Who: Men & Women, Singles & Couples

Day & Time: Wednesday, March 15 @ 7:00-9:00pm

Location: We will meet at Brookfield Place located at 220 Vesey Street (West of West Street). We will meet in the Atrium near the amphitheater and palm trees.


Cost: FREE

http://www.hopehill.com


#HopeHillNYC

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely "run in the dark" with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles. 

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Special equipment: Headlamp or small flashlight (winter months)

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. If the weather is warm, I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
Click the link below to officially reserve a spot on this event:


http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-after-hours-tour-the-museum-of-the-american-gangster-tickets-23806042514?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club for an after-hours tour @ the Museum of the American Gangster; located in a former speakeasy, the goal of the Museum of the American Gangster is to objectively present the role that crime has played in shaping the politics, culture, myth and lore of New York City — and beyond.

Our experience will include: 

• Encounters with museum objects such a Tommy gun and the death masks of John Dillinger

• An exploration of the history of Jewish and Italian gangsters, and their involvement in the city's prohibition movement

• The story of popular resistance to the anti-drinking law, from song sheets to imagery of bootleggers' souped-up cars and boats

• A trip through the hidden and preserved spaces of the old speakeasy, where the owner once stashed millions in illegal cash.

Afterwards, we'll grab drinks in the building's (legal) speakeasy!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: After-Hours Tour @ the Museum of the American Gangster

results.description:
RAVENLOFT RETURNS!

Join us for the launch of a brand new season of D&D Encounters! Ravenloft, the classic D&D setting of gothic horror, rises from the grave as we begin with the exclusive Adventure’s League adventures leading up to Death House. This is a 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons game for 6 players. Reserving a seat is no charge, but players pay a $10 door fee. Adventurer’s League passes can be purchases for $80, which cover 10 sessions of play.

In order to RSVP, players must go to our registration page and sign up for a specific table. Be sure to read the description to find out if the table matches your experience level! Be warned that signing up on this Meetup page does NOT guarantee a player a spot at a table.

Register here: bstrat.eventsmart.com

Play begins around 7:30pm and ends at 10:30pm. Late arrivals and early exits should try to notify their DM in advance, but are rarely a problem.

We will be creating characters during this first session and then running a three-week introduction to the game, a perfect opportunity for players who are looking to begin a fresh new campaign. Players are welcome to bring ideas for their character, or even build a 1st level character in advance and help the newer members. Character sheets, pencils, paper, dice, miniatures, and battlemaps are all provided by the store; copies of rulebooks are available to borrow, but are limited by supply. Players are welcome to bring their own gaming supplies as well as snacks and beverages.

Encounters welcomes brand-new players every week, so don’t hesitate to jump into one of our Beginner-level tables with no prior RPG experience!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Curse of Strahd

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.

results.description:
Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6031 is required

results.description:
About Enviromental Green Drinks Gatherings

Environmental Green Drinks is an informal monthly get-together for people interested in green living, sustainable business and building communities that are safe for living, biking, walking and growing food. We meet at places where the food is excellent and the prices are good.

Green Drinks are open, admission is free and new faces are always welcome, so come and join us some evening!

Acerca de las Reuniones Green Drinks

Green Drinks es un informal evento social para gente interesada en la sostenibilidad y el medio ambiente. Las reuniones facilitan el intercambio informal de ideas y estrategias "verdes" y colaboraciones comunitarias e individuales. Conversamos sobre alternativos fuentes de energía limpia, producción agrícola urbana, la comida natural y orgánica, comprar local, los empleos verdes. . . y la justicia ambiental. Nuestros encuentros están abiertos a la comunidad y todos encontrarán una calurosa bienvenida.

Os Eventos Green Drinks

Green Drinks é um evento social informal para dialogar sobre o estabelecimento duma sociedade sustentável, justa e no qual os comerciantes e indivíduos respeitam os recursos da terra e seus habitantes. A comunidade está muito bem vinda!

results.description:
Hot off the current events with Mircosoft's TAY meltdown, we will be tonight speaking about how to create AI that can learn from humans, but still maintain basic ethical principles. This will touch upon Asimov's three robot rules, but also extend beyond, to that nebulous area of gray issues.

Some questions to consider:
How could an AI weigh cultural and moral judgements? Or can it even do so?

How can one program an AI that is flexible enough to learn from us, but not too flexible to become a Nazi loving sex crazed cyber troll?

Since biases in part of the creators cannot be eliminated, and the AI has to learn from the world, what biases should we program the with AI to avoid TAY like outcomes?

What philosophical, mathematical or engineering approaches can we undertake?

And more questions.

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
Wednesday night training tends to focus on randori (free response training), and with work on one or two techniques or drills. If you are new to training, this will not be as intense for you as for people that have been training long term. Please check the FAQ if you have any questions. If there isn't an answer there, shoot me an email, and I'll respond as soon as possible.

Class is free if it's your first time.  You can start training in sweats and a T-shirt or bring your own gi. We also ask that your fingernails and toenail be clipped short to avoid injury.  

Please fill out this form (just name, address, contact information, and sign date it) and bring it with you.  Do not worry about paying the fee.  You'll do that if you continue training with us.  It's just that the form is also the liability waiver.

Dojo visitors from other training groups (Judo, BJJ, DZR) may pay the one time mat fee to train.

Approximate breakdown of class:
7:30: setup and change
7:45: Begin stretching and ukemi work
8:15: Begin technique work
8:30: randori/sparing 
9:20: Conditioning
9:30: Class ends, put away mats, change.

Dojo visitors from other training groups (Judo, BJJ, DZR) may pay the one time mat fee to train.
results.name: Wednesday Night Randori Training

Class focus is on restorative postures with a gentle sequence. Good for anyone, especially those looking to practice yoga from a gentle perspective.
Yoga can be taught from a chair seated and standing with the aid of the back of the chair to modify postures and create a individualized experience.
Vinyasa and Core Strength Yoga are taught in fusion. Breathing techniques are taught in sequence with posture names, positioning, parts of the body that benefit (adverse muscle groups, organs and nervous system) and the Chakras that will be balanced in association.
Extra 15 minute meditation practice given after class during Savasana (final relaxation) for those interested in a deeper practice. Bringing greater spirituality, grounding and peace of mind. 

Discount for those 65 years or over or on Medicare. 

This is a wheel chair excessible facility.

Free Parking. 

$12 a lesson.

$10 for seniors.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

Want to get out of the house or studio and refresh your artistic skills or just enjoy figure drawing? Looking to meet new local people, network and exchange ideas and have fun? Come and join us at the Figure Drawing Wednesday!

Location? Eckford Street Studio on

70 Eckford Street, Brooklyn NY 11222

Time? Wednesday from 8pm-10pm

Come and explore your talents and enjoy an evening focused on figure drawing from a live model. No need to be a pro just bring the material you feel comfortable to work with and enjoy a creative evening!

Prices for the fall are:

$75 for 5 sessions

Drop-ins are welcome $17

On going sessions....

Bring your own drink too!

You can register on </a>http://goo.gl/forms/uMojjWgnCY

for more info please call (347)[masked] or email [masked]

About the Host

Hilda Abla - aka "Hildos" is a Lebanese-Armenian artist living in Brooklyn. She started her artistic ventures at age five at the children's program at Lebanese American University, the same institution where she earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts years later. Her painting studies continued at the School of Visual Arts, and she has exhibited her work in Beirut and New York, and been featured in magazines New York Art Magazine and Art Fuse. She believes that art comes with a responsibility, and her latest work is committed to changing the way women view their bodies and themselves. You can view her work at <a href="http://hildos.com">hildos.com , including her TEDx talk on "Seeing Beauty in Imperfection".

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session: Mar 02, 2016-Apr 06, 2016
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6


  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8:30-10:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 8:30-10:30pm ($10)

The show is FREE and takes place at Stone Creek Bar in Murray Hill, just 2 blocks from the 6-train 28th St stop.

Seating is limited and by reservation only. To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door. There will also be FREE DRINK and FREE COMEDY CLUB Ticket giveaways!!

Come solo or bring friends its all good.
Seating starts in the backroom at 9 and the show starts shortly after.

**The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.**

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
